property.name: hive.exec.stagingdir
property.description: Directory name that will be created inside table locations in order to support HDFS encryption. This is replaces ${hive.exec.scratchdir} for query results with the exception of read-only tables. In all cases ${hive.exec.scratchdir} is still used for other temporary files, such as job plans.

property.name: hive.exec.scratchdir
property.description: HDFS root scratch dir for Hive jobs which gets created with write all (733) permission. For each connecting user, an HDFS scratch dir: ${hive.exec.scratchdir}/<username> is created, with ${hive.scratch.dir.permission}.

property.name: hive.repl.rootdir
property.description: HDFS root dir for all replication dumps.

property.name: hive.repl.cm.enabled
property.description: Turn on ChangeManager, so delete files will go to cmrootdir.

property.name: hive.repl.cmrootdir
property.description: Root dir for ChangeManager, used for deleted files.

property.name: hive.repl.cm.retain
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is hour if not specified. Time to retain removed files in cmrootdir.

property.name: hive.repl.cm.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Inteval for cmroot cleanup thread.

property.name: hive.repl.replica.functions.root.dir
property.description: Root directory on the replica warehouse where the repl sub-system will store jars from the primary warehouse

property.name: hive.repl.approx.max.load.tasks
property.description: Provide an approximation of the maximum number of tasks that should be executed before dynamically generating the next set of tasks. The number is approximate as Hive will stop at a slightly higher number, the reason being some events might lead to a task increment that would cross the specified limit.

property.name: hive.repl.partitions.dump.parallelism
property.description: Number of threads that will be used to dump partition data information during repl dump.

property.name: hive.repl.dumpdir.clean.freq
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Frequency at which timer task runs to purge expired dump dirs.

property.name: hive.repl.dumpdir.ttl
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is day if not specified. TTL of dump dirs before cleanup.

property.name: hive.repl.dump.metadata.only
property.description: Indicates whether replication dump only metadata information or data + metadata.

property.name: hive.repl.dump.include.acid.tables
property.description: Indicates if repl dump should include information about ACID tables. It should be used in conjunction with 'hive.repl.dump.metadata.only' to enable copying of metadata for acid tables which do not require the corresponding transaction semantics to be applied on target. This can be removed when ACID table replication is supported.

property.name: hive.repl.bootstrap.dump.open.txn.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is hour if not specified. Indicates the timeout for all transactions which are opened before triggering bootstrap REPL DUMP. If these open transactions are not closed within the timeout value, then REPL DUMP will forcefully abort those transactions and continue with bootstrap dump.

property.name: hive.repl.add.raw.reserved.namespace
property.description: For TDE with same encryption keys on source and target, allow Distcp super user to access the raw bytes from filesystem without decrypting on source and then encrypting on target.

property.name: hive.exec.local.scratchdir
property.description: Local scratch space for Hive jobs

property.name: hive.downloaded.resources.dir
property.description: Temporary local directory for added resources in the remote file system.

property.name: hive.scratch.dir.permission
property.description: The permission for the user specific scratch directories that get created.

property.name: hive.exec.submit.local.task.via.child
property.description: Determines whether local tasks (typically mapjoin hashtable generation phase) runs in separate JVM (true recommended) or not. Avoids the overhead of spawning new JVM, but can lead to out-of-memory issues.

property.name: hive.exec.script.maxerrsize
property.description: Maximum number of bytes a script is allowed to emit to standard error (per map-reduce task). This prevents runaway scripts from filling logs partitions to capacity

property.name: hive.exec.script.allow.partial.consumption
property.description: When enabled, this option allows a user script to exit successfully without consuming all the data from the standard input.

property.name: stream.stderr.reporter.prefix
property.description: Streaming jobs that log to standard error with this prefix can log counter or status information.

property.name: stream.stderr.reporter.enabled
property.description: Enable consumption of status and counter messages for streaming jobs.

property.name: hive.exec.compress.output
property.description: This controls whether the final outputs of a query (to a local/HDFS file or a Hive table) is compressed. The compression codec and other options are determined from Hadoop config variables mapred.output.compress*

property.name: hive.exec.compress.intermediate
property.description: This controls whether intermediate files produced by Hive between multiple map-reduce jobs are compressed. The compression codec and other options are determined from Hadoop config variables mapred.output.compress*

property.name: hive.exec.reducers.bytes.per.reducer
property.description: size per reducer.The default is 256Mb, i.e if the input size is 1G, it will use 4 reducers.

property.name: hive.exec.reducers.max
property.description: max number of reducers will be used. If the one specified in the configuration parameter mapred.reduce.tasks is negative, Hive will use this one as the max number of reducers when automatically determine number of reducers.

property.name: hive.exec.pre.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of pre-execution hooks to be invoked for each statement. A pre-execution hook is specified as the name of a Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.exec.post.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of post-execution hooks to be invoked for each statement. A post-execution hook is specified as the name of a Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.exec.failure.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of on-failure hooks to be invoked for each statement. An on-failure hook is specified as the name of Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.ExecuteWithHookContext interface.

property.name: hive.exec.query.redactor.hooks
property.description: Comma-separated list of hooks to be invoked for each query which can tranform the query before it's placed in the job.xml file. Must be a Java class which extends from the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.hooks.Redactor abstract class.

property.name: hive.client.stats.publishers
property.description: Comma-separated list of statistics publishers to be invoked on counters on each job. A client stats publisher is specified as the name of a Java class which implements the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.stats.ClientStatsPublisher interface.

property.name: hive.ats.hook.queue.capacity
property.description: Queue size for the ATS Hook executor. If the number of outstanding submissions to the ATS executor exceed this amount, the Hive ATS Hook will not try to log queries to ATS.

property.name: hive.exec.parallel
property.description: Whether to execute jobs in parallel

property.name: hive.exec.parallel.thread.number
property.description: How many jobs at most can be executed in parallel

property.name: hive.mapred.reduce.tasks.speculative.execution
property.description: Whether speculative execution for reducers should be turned on.

property.name: hive.exec.counters.pull.interval
property.description: The interval with which to poll the JobTracker for the counters the running job. The smaller it is the more load there will be on the jobtracker, the higher it is the less granular the caught will be.

property.name: hive.exec.dynamic.partition
property.description: Whether or not to allow dynamic partitions in DML/DDL.

property.name: hive.exec.dynamic.partition.mode
property.description: In strict mode, the user must specify at least one static partition in case the user accidentally overwrites all partitions. In nonstrict mode all partitions are allowed to be dynamic.

property.name: hive.exec.max.dynamic.partitions
property.description: Maximum number of dynamic partitions allowed to be created in total.

property.name: hive.exec.max.dynamic.partitions.pernode
property.description: Maximum number of dynamic partitions allowed to be created in each mapper/reducer node.

property.name: hive.exec.max.created.files
property.description: Maximum number of HDFS files created by all mappers/reducers in a MapReduce job.

property.name: hive.exec.default.partition.name
property.description: The default partition name in case the dynamic partition column value is null/empty string or any other values that cannot be escaped. This value must not contain any special character used in HDFS URI (e.g., ':', '%', '/' etc). The user has to be aware that the dynamic partition value should not contain this value to avoid confusions.

property.name: hive.exec.show.job.failure.debug.info
property.description: If a job fails, whether to provide a link in the CLI to the task with the most failures, along with debugging hints if applicable.

property.name: hive.exec.job.debug.capture.stacktraces
property.description: Whether or not stack traces parsed from the task logs of a sampled failed task for each failed job should be stored in the SessionState

property.name: hive.output.file.extension
property.description: String used as a file extension for output files. If not set, defaults to the codec extension for text files (e.g. ".gz"), or no extension otherwise.

property.name: hive.testing.short.logs
property.description: internal usage only, used only in test mode. If set true, when requesting the operation logs the short version (generated by LogDivertAppenderForTest) will be returned

property.name: hive.testing.remove.logs
property.description: internal usage only, used only in test mode. If set false, the operation logs, and the operation log directory will not be removed, so they can be found after the test runs.

property.name: hive.exec.mode.local.auto
property.description: Let Hive determine whether to run in local mode automatically

property.name: hive.exec.mode.local.auto.inputbytes.max
property.description: When hive.exec.mode.local.auto is true, input bytes should less than this for local mode.

property.name: hive.exec.mode.local.auto.input.files.max
property.description: When hive.exec.mode.local.auto is true, the number of tasks should less than this for local mode.

property.name: hive.exec.drop.ignorenonexistent
property.description: Do not report an error if DROP TABLE/VIEW/Index/Function specifies a non-existent table/view/function

property.name: hive.ignore.mapjoin.hint
property.description: Ignore the mapjoin hint

property.name: hive.file.max.footer
property.description: maximum number of lines for footer user can define for a table file

property.name: hive.resultset.use.unique.column.names
property.description: Make column names unique in the result set by qualifying column names with table alias if needed. Table alias will be added to column names for queries of type "select *" or if query explicitly uses table alias "select r1.x..".

property.name: fs.har.impl
property.description: The implementation for accessing Hadoop Archives. Note that this won't be applicable to Hadoop versions less than 0.20

property.name: hive.metastore.db.type
property.description: Expects one of [derby, oracle, mysql, mssql, postgres]. Type of database used by the metastore. Information schema & JDBCStorageHandler depend on it.

property.name: hive.metastore.warehouse.dir
property.description: location of default database for the warehouse

property.name: hive.metastore.warehouse.external.dir
property.description: Default location for external tables created in the warehouse. If not set or null, then the normal warehouse location will be used as the default location.

property.name: hive.metastore.uris
property.description: Thrift URI for the remote metastore. Used by metastore client to connect to remote metastore.

property.name: hive.metastore.uri.selection
property.description: Expects one of [sequential, random]. Determines the selection mechanism used by metastore client to connect to remote metastore. SEQUENTIAL implies that the first valid metastore from the URIs specified as part of hive.metastore.uris will be picked. RANDOM implies that the metastore will be picked randomly

property.name: hive.metastore.client.capability.check
property.description: Whether to check client capabilities for potentially breaking API usage.

property.name: hive.metastore.client.cache.enabled
property.description: Whether to enable metastore client cache

property.name: hive.metastore.client.cache.expiry.time
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Expiry time for metastore client cache

property.name: hive.metastore.client.cache.initial.capacity
property.description: Initial capacity for metastore client cache

property.name: hive.metastore.client.cache.max.capacity
property.description: Max capacity for metastore client cache

property.name: hive.metastore.client.cache.stats.enabled
property.description: Whether to enable metastore client cache stats

property.name: hive.metastore.fastpath
property.description: Used to avoid all of the proxies and object copies in the metastore. Note, if this is set, you MUST use a local metastore (hive.metastore.uris must be empty) otherwise undefined and most likely undesired behavior will result

property.name: hive.metastore.fshandler.threads
property.description: Number of threads to be allocated for metastore handler for fs operations.

property.name: hive.metastore.hbase.file.metadata.threads
property.description: Number of threads to use to read file metadata in background to cache it.

property.name: hive.metastore.uri.resolver
property.description: If set, fully qualified class name of resolver for hive metastore uri's

property.name: hive.metastore.connect.retries
property.description: Number of retries while opening a connection to metastore

property.name: hive.metastore.failure.retries
property.description: Number of retries upon failure of Thrift metastore calls

property.name: hive.metastore.port
property.description: Hive metastore listener port

property.name: hive.metastore.client.connect.retry.delay
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Number of seconds for the client to wait between consecutive connection attempts

property.name: hive.metastore.client.socket.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. MetaStore Client socket timeout in seconds

property.name: hive.metastore.client.socket.lifetime
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. MetaStore Client socket lifetime in seconds. After this time is exceeded, client reconnects on the next MetaStore operation. A value of 0s means the connection has an infinite lifetime.

property.name: hive.metastore.ds.connection.url.hook
property.description: Name of the hook to use for retrieving the JDO connection URL. If empty, the value in javax.jdo.option.ConnectionURL is used

property.name: javax.jdo.option.Multithreaded
property.description: Set this to true if multiple threads access metastore through JDO concurrently.

property.name: hive.metastore.dbaccess.ssl.properties
property.description: Comma-separated SSL properties for metastore to access database when JDO connection URL enables SSL access. e.g. javax.net.ssl.trustStore=/tmp/truststore,javax.net.ssl.trustStorePassword=pwd.

property.name: hive.hmshandler.retry.attempts
property.description: The number of times to retry a HMSHandler call if there were a connection error.

property.name: hive.hmshandler.retry.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. The time between HMSHandler retry attempts on failure.

property.name: hive.hmshandler.force.reload.conf
property.description: Whether to force reloading of the HMSHandler configuration (including the connection URL, before the next metastore query that accesses the datastore. Once reloaded, this value is reset to false. Used for testing only.

property.name: hive.metastore.server.max.message.size
property.description: Maximum message size in bytes a HMS will accept.

property.name: hive.metastore.server.min.threads
property.description: Minimum number of worker threads in the Thrift server's pool.

property.name: hive.metastore.server.max.threads
property.description: Maximum number of worker threads in the Thrift server's pool.

property.name: hive.metastore.server.tcp.keepalive
property.description: Whether to enable TCP keepalive for the metastore server. Keepalive will prevent accumulation of half-open connections.

property.name: hive.metastore.wm.default.pool.size
property.description: The size of a default pool to create when creating an empty resource plan; If not positive, no default pool will be created.

property.name: hive.metastore.archive.intermediate.original
property.description: Intermediate dir suffixes used for archiving. Not important what they are, as long as collisions are avoided

property.name: hive.metastore.kerberos.keytab.file
property.description: The path to the Kerberos Keytab file containing the metastore Thrift server's service principal.

property.name: hive.metastore.kerberos.principal
property.description: The service principal for the metastore Thrift server. The special string _HOST will be replaced automatically with the correct host name.

property.name: hive.metastore.client.kerberos.principal
property.description: The Kerberos principal associated with the HA cluster of hcat_servers.

property.name: hive.metastore.sasl.enabled
property.description: If true, the metastore Thrift interface will be secured with SASL. Clients must authenticate with Kerberos.

property.name: hive.metastore.thrift.framed.transport.enabled
property.description: If true, the metastore Thrift interface will use TFramedTransport. When false (default) a standard TTransport is used.

property.name: hive.metastore.thrift.compact.protocol.enabled
property.description: If true, the metastore Thrift interface will use TCompactProtocol. When false (default) TBinaryProtocol will be used. Setting it to true will break compatibility with older clients running TBinaryProtocol.

property.name: hive.metastore.token.signature
property.description: The delegation token service name to match when selecting a token from the current user's tokens.

property.name: hive.cluster.delegation.token.store.class
property.description: The delegation token store implementation. Set to org.apache.hadoop.hive.thrift.ZooKeeperTokenStore for load-balanced cluster.

property.name: hive.cluster.delegation.token.store.zookeeper.connectString
property.description: The ZooKeeper token store connect string. You can re-use the configuration value set in hive.zookeeper.quorum, by leaving this parameter unset.

property.name: hive.cluster.delegation.token.store.zookeeper.znode
property.description: The root path for token store data. Note that this is used by both HiveServer2 and MetaStore to store delegation Token. One directory gets created for each of them. The final directory names would have the servername appended to it (HIVESERVER2, METASTORE).

property.name: hive.cluster.delegation.token.store.zookeeper.acl
property.description: ACL for token store entries. Comma separated list of ACL entries. For example: sasl:hive/host1@MY.DOMAIN:cdrwa,sasl:hive/host2@MY.DOMAIN:cdrwa Defaults to all permissions for the hiveserver2/metastore process user.

property.name: hive.metastore.cache.pinobjtypes
property.description: List of comma separated metastore object types that should be pinned in the cache

property.name: datanucleus.connectionPoolingType
property.description: Expects one of [bonecp, dbcp, hikaricp, none]. Specify connection pool library for datanucleus

property.name: datanucleus.connectionPool.maxPoolSize
property.description: Specify the maximum number of connections in the connection pool. Note: The configured size will be used by 2 connection pools (TxnHandler and ObjectStore). When configuring the max connection pool size, it is recommended to take into account the number of metastore instances and the number of HiveServer2 instances configured with embedded metastore. To get optimal performance, set config to meet the following condition (2 * pool_size * metastore_instances + 2 * pool_size * HS2_instances_with_embedded_metastore) = (2 * physical_core_count + hard_disk_count).

property.name: datanucleus.rdbms.initializeColumnInfo
property.description: initializeColumnInfo setting for DataNucleus; set to NONE at least on Postgres.

property.name: datanucleus.schema.validateTables
property.description: validates existing schema against code. turn this on if you want to verify existing schema

property.name: datanucleus.schema.validateColumns
property.description: validates existing schema against code. turn this on if you want to verify existing schema

property.name: datanucleus.schema.validateConstraints
property.description: validates existing schema against code. turn this on if you want to verify existing schema

property.name: datanucleus.storeManagerType
property.description: metadata store type

property.name: datanucleus.schema.autoCreateAll
property.description: Auto creates necessary schema on a startup if one doesn't exist. Set this to false, after creating it once.To enable auto create also set hive.metastore.schema.verification=false. Auto creation is not recommended for production use cases, run schematool command instead.

property.name: hive.metastore.schema.verification
property.description: Enforce metastore schema version consistency. True: Verify that version information stored in is compatible with one from Hive jars. Also disable automatic schema migration attempt. Users are required to manually migrate schema after Hive upgrade which ensures proper metastore schema migration. (Default) False: Warn if the version information stored in metastore doesn't match with one from in Hive jars.

property.name: hive.metastore.schema.verification.record.version
property.description: When true the current MS version is recorded in the VERSION table. If this is disabled and verification is enabled the MS will be unusable.

property.name: hive.metastore.schema.info.class
property.description: Fully qualified class name for the metastore schema information class which is used by schematool to fetch the schema information. This class should implement the IMetaStoreSchemaInfo interface

property.name: datanucleus.transactionIsolation
property.description: Default transaction isolation level for identity generation.

property.name: datanucleus.cache.level2
property.description: Use a level 2 cache. Turn this off if metadata is changed independently of Hive metastore server

property.name: datanucleus.identifierFactory
property.description: Name of the identifier factory to use when generating table/column names etc. 'datanucleus1' is used for backward compatibility with DataNucleus v1

property.name: datanucleus.plugin.pluginRegistryBundleCheck
property.description: Defines what happens when plugin bundles are found and are duplicated [EXCEPTION|LOG|NONE]

property.name: hive.metastore.batch.retrieve.max
property.description: Maximum number of objects (tables/partitions) can be retrieved from metastore in one batch. The higher the number, the less the number of round trips is needed to the Hive metastore server, but it may also cause higher memory requirement at the client side.

property.name: hive.metastore.batch.retrieve.table.partition.max
property.description: Maximum number of objects that metastore internally retrieves in one batch.

property.name: hive.metastore.init.hooks
property.description: A comma separated list of hooks to be invoked at the beginning of HMSHandler initialization. An init hook is specified as the name of Java class which extends org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.MetaStoreInitListener.

property.name: hive.metastore.pre.event.listeners
property.description: List of comma separated listeners for metastore events.

property.name: hive.metastore.event.listeners
property.description: A comma separated list of Java classes that implement the org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.MetaStoreEventListener interface. The metastore event and corresponding listener method will be invoked in separate JDO transactions. Alternatively, configure hive.metastore.transactional.event.listeners to ensure both are invoked in same JDO transaction.

property.name: hive.metastore.transactional.event.listeners
property.description: A comma separated list of Java classes that implement the org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.MetaStoreEventListener interface. Both the metastore event and corresponding listener method will be invoked in the same JDO transaction.

property.name: hive.notification.sequence.lock.max.retries
property.description: Number of retries required to acquire a lock when getting the next notification sequential ID for entries in the NOTIFICATION_LOG table.

property.name: hive.notification.sequence.lock.retry.sleep.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Sleep interval between retries to acquire a notification lock as described part of property NOTIFICATION_SEQUENCE_LOCK_MAX_RETRIES

property.name: hive.metastore.event.db.listener.timetolive
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. time after which events will be removed from the database listener queue

property.name: hive.metastore.event.db.notification.api.auth
property.description: Should metastore do authorization against database notification related APIs such as get_next_notification. If set to true, then only the superusers in proxy settings have the permission

property.name: hive.metastore.authorization.storage.checks
property.description: Should the metastore do authorization checks against the underlying storage (usually hdfs) for operations like drop-partition (disallow the drop-partition if the user in question doesn't have permissions to delete the corresponding directory on the storage).

property.name: hive.metastore.authorization.storage.check.externaltable.drop
property.description: Should StorageBasedAuthorization check permission of the storage before dropping external table. StorageBasedAuthorization already does this check for managed table. For external table however, anyone who has read permission of the directory could drop external table, which is surprising. The flag is set to false by default to maintain backward compatibility.

property.name: hive.metastore.event.clean.freq
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Frequency at which timer task runs to purge expired events in metastore.

property.name: hive.metastore.event.expiry.duration
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Duration after which events expire from events table

property.name: hive.metastore.event.message.factory
property.description: Factory class for making encoding and decoding messages in the events generated.

property.name: hive.metastore.execute.setugi
property.description: In unsecure mode, setting this property to true will cause the metastore to execute DFS operations using the client's reported user and group permissions. Note that this property must be set on both the client and server sides. Further note that its best effort. If client sets its to true and server sets it to false, client setting will be ignored.

property.name: hive.metastore.partition.name.whitelist.pattern
property.description: Partition names will be checked against this regex pattern and rejected if not matched.

property.name: hive.metastore.integral.jdo.pushdown
property.description: Allow JDO query pushdown for integral partition columns in metastore. Off by default. This improves metastore perf for integral columns, especially if there's a large number of partitions. However, it doesn't work correctly with integral values that are not normalized (e.g. have leading zeroes, like 0012). If metastore direct SQL is enabled and works, this optimization is also irrelevant.

property.name: hive.metastore.try.direct.sql
property.description: Whether the Hive metastore should try to use direct SQL queries instead of the DataNucleus for certain read paths. This can improve metastore performance when fetching many partitions or column statistics by orders of magnitude; however, it is not guaranteed to work on all RDBMS-es and all versions. In case of SQL failures, the metastore will fall back to the DataNucleus, so it's safe even if SQL doesn't work for all queries on your datastore. If all SQL queries fail (for example, your metastore is backed by MongoDB), you might want to disable this to save the try-and-fall-back cost.

property.name: hive.metastore.direct.sql.batch.size
property.description: Batch size for partition and other object retrieval from the underlying DB in direct SQL. For some DBs like Oracle and MSSQL, there are hardcoded or perf-based limitations that necessitate this. For DBs that can handle the queries, this isn't necessary and may impede performance. -1 means no batching, 0 means automatic batching.

property.name: hive.metastore.try.direct.sql.ddl
property.description: Same as hive.metastore.try.direct.sql, for read statements within a transaction that modifies metastore data. Due to non-standard behavior in Postgres, if a direct SQL select query has incorrect syntax or something similar inside a transaction, the entire transaction will fail and fall-back to DataNucleus will not be possible. You should disable the usage of direct SQL inside transactions if that happens in your case.

property.name: hive.direct.sql.max.query.length
property.description: The maximum size of a query string (in KB).

property.name: hive.direct.sql.max.elements.in.clause
property.description: The maximum number of values in a IN clause. Once exceeded, it will be broken into multiple OR separated IN clauses.

property.name: hive.direct.sql.max.elements.values.clause
property.description: The maximum number of values in a VALUES clause for INSERT statement.

property.name: hive.metastore.orm.retrieveMapNullsAsEmptyStrings
property.description: Thrift does not support nulls in maps, so any nulls present in maps retrieved from ORM must either be pruned or converted to empty strings. Some backing dbs such as Oracle persist empty strings as nulls, so we should set this parameter if we wish to reverse that behaviour. For others, pruning is the correct behaviour

property.name: hive.metastore.disallow.incompatible.col.type.changes
property.description:
If true (default is false), ALTER TABLE operations which change the type of a column (say STRING) to an incompatible type (say MAP) are disallowed. RCFile default SerDe (ColumnarSerDe) serializes the values in such a way that the datatypes can be converted from string to any type. The map is also serialized as a string, which can be read as a string as well. However, with any binary serialization, this is not true. Blocking the ALTER TABLE prevents ClassCastExceptions when subsequently trying to access old partitions.
Primitive types like INT, STRING, BIGINT, etc., are compatible with each other and are not blocked.
See HIVE-4409 for more details.

property.name: hive.metastore.limit.partition.request
property.description: This limits the number of partitions that can be requested from the metastore for a given table. The default value "-1" means no limit.

property.name: hive.table.parameters.default
property.description: Default property values for newly created tables

property.name: hive.ddl.createtablelike.properties.whitelist
property.description: Table Properties to copy over when executing a Create Table Like.

property.name: hive.metastore.rawstore.impl
property.description: Name of the class that implements org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.rawstore interface. This class is used to store and retrieval of raw metadata objects such as table, database

property.name: hive.metastore.txn.store.impl
property.description: Name of class that implements org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.txn.TxnStore. This class is used to store and retrieve transactions and locks

property.name: javax.jdo.option.ConnectionDriverName
property.description: Driver class name for a JDBC metastore

property.name: javax.jdo.PersistenceManagerFactoryClass
property.description: class implementing the jdo persistence

property.name: javax.jdo.option.DetachAllOnCommit
property.description: Detaches all objects from session so that they can be used after transaction is committed

property.name: javax.jdo.option.NonTransactionalRead
property.description: Reads outside of transactions

property.name: hive.metastore.end.function.listeners
property.description: List of comma separated listeners for the end of metastore functions.

property.name: hive.metastore.partition.inherit.table.properties
property.description: List of comma separated keys occurring in table properties which will get inherited to newly created partitions. * implies all the keys will get inherited.

property.name: hive.metastore.filter.hook
property.description: Metastore hook class for filtering the metadata read results. If hive.security.authorization.manageris set to instance of HiveAuthorizerFactory, then this value is ignored.

property.name: hive.metastore.dml.events
property.description: If true, the metastore will be asked to fire events for DML operations

property.name: hive.metastore.client.drop.partitions.using.expressions
property.description: Choose whether dropping partitions with HCatClient pushes the partition-predicate to the metastore, or drops partitions iteratively

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.enabled
property.description: Whether aggregate stats caching is enabled or not.

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.size
property.description: Maximum number of aggregate stats nodes that we will place in the metastore aggregate stats cache.

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.max.partitions
property.description: Maximum number of partitions that are aggregated per cache node.

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.fpp
property.description: Maximum false positive probability for the Bloom Filter used in each aggregate stats cache node (default 1%).

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.max.variance
property.description: Maximum tolerable variance in number of partitions between a cached node and our request (default 1%).

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.ttl
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Number of seconds for a cached node to be active in the cache before they become stale.

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.max.writer.wait
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Number of milliseconds a writer will wait to acquire the writelock before giving up.

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.max.reader.wait
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Number of milliseconds a reader will wait to acquire the readlock before giving up.

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.max.full
property.description: Maximum cache full % after which the cache cleaner thread kicks in.

property.name: hive.metastore.aggregate.stats.cache.clean.until
property.description: The cleaner thread cleans until cache reaches this % full size.

property.name: hive.metastore.metrics.enabled
property.description: Enable metrics on the metastore.

property.name: hive.metastore.initial.metadata.count.enabled
property.description: Enable a metadata count at metastore startup for metrics.

property.name: hive.metastore.use.SSL
property.description: Set this to true for using SSL encryption in HMS server.

property.name: hive.metastore.keystore.path
property.description: Metastore SSL certificate keystore location.

property.name: hive.metastore.keystore.password
property.description: Metastore SSL certificate keystore password.

property.name: hive.metastore.truststore.path
property.description: Metastore SSL certificate truststore location.

property.name: hive.metastore.truststore.password
property.description: Metastore SSL certificate truststore password.

property.name: hive.metadata.export.location
property.description: When used in conjunction with the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.MetaDataExportListener pre event listener, it is the location to which the metadata will be exported. The default is an empty string, which results in the metadata being exported to the current user's home directory on HDFS.

property.name: hive.metadata.move.exported.metadata.to.trash
property.description: When used in conjunction with the org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.MetaDataExportListener pre event listener, this setting determines if the metadata that is exported will subsequently be moved to the user's trash directory alongside the dropped table data. This ensures that the metadata will be cleaned up along with the dropped table data.

property.name: hive.cli.print.current.db
property.description: Whether to include the current database in the Hive prompt.

property.name: hive.cli.prompt
property.description: Command line prompt configuration value. Other hiveconf can be used in this configuration value. Variable substitution will only be invoked at the Hive CLI startup.

property.name: hive.cli.pretty.output.num.cols
property.description: The number of columns to use when formatting output generated by the DESCRIBE PRETTY table_name command. If the value of this property is -1, then Hive will use the auto-detected terminal width.

property.name: hive.local.time.zone
property.description: Sets the time-zone for displaying and interpreting time stamps. If this property value is set to LOCAL, it is not specified, or it is not a correct time-zone, the system default time-zone will be used instead. Time-zone IDs can be specified as region-based zone IDs (based on IANA time-zone data), abbreviated zone IDs, or offset IDs.

property.name: hive.session.history.enabled
property.description: Whether to log Hive query, query plan, runtime statistics etc.

property.name: hive.query.string
property.description: Query being executed (might be multiple per a session)

property.name: hive.query.id
property.description: ID for query being executed (might be multiple per a session)

property.name: hive.jobname.length
property.description: max jobname length

property.name: hive.jar.path
property.description: The location of hive_cli.jar that is used when submitting jobs in a separate jvm.

property.name: hive.aux.jars.path
property.description: The location of the plugin jars that contain implementations of user defined functions and serdes.

property.name: hive.reloadable.aux.jars.path
property.description: The locations of the plugin jars, which can be a comma-separated folders or jars. Jars can be renewed by executing reload command. And these jars can be used as the auxiliary classes like creating a UDF or SerDe.

property.name: hive.added.files.path
property.description: This an internal parameter.

property.name: hive.added.jars.path
property.description: This an internal parameter.

property.name: hive.added.archives.path
property.description: This an internal parameter.

property.name: hive.resource.use.hdfs.location
property.description: Reference HDFS based files/jars directly instead of copy to session based HDFS scratch directory, to make distributed cache more useful.

property.name: hive.auto.progress.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. How long to run autoprogressor for the script/UDTF operators. Set to 0 for forever.

property.name: hive.script.auto.progress
property.description: Whether Hive Transform/Map/Reduce Clause should automatically send progress information to TaskTracker to avoid the task getting killed because of inactivity. Hive sends progress information when the script is outputting to stderr. This option removes the need of periodically producing stderr messages, but users should be cautious because this may prevent infinite loops in the scripts to be killed by TaskTracker.

property.name: hive.script.operator.id.env.var
property.description: Name of the environment variable that holds the unique script operator ID in the user's transform function (the custom mapper/reducer that the user has specified in the query)

property.name: hive.script.operator.truncate.env
property.description: Truncate each environment variable for external script in scripts operator to 20KB (to fit system limits)

property.name: hive.script.operator.env.blacklist
property.description: Comma separated list of keys from the configuration file not to convert to environment variables when invoking the script operator

property.name: hive.strict.checks.orderby.no.limit
property.description: Enabling strict large query checks disallows the following: Orderby without limit. Note that this check currently does not consider data size, only the query pattern.

property.name: hive.strict.checks.no.partition.filter
property.description: Enabling strict large query checks disallows the following: No partition being picked up for a query against partitioned table. Note that this check currently does not consider data size, only the query pattern.

property.name: hive.strict.checks.type.safety
property.description: Enabling strict type safety checks disallows the following: Comparing bigints and strings. Comparing bigints and doubles.

property.name: hive.strict.checks.cartesian.product
property.description: Enabling strict Cartesian join checks disallows the following: Cartesian product (cross join).

property.name: hive.strict.checks.bucketing
property.description: Enabling strict bucketing checks disallows the following: Load into bucketed tables.

property.name: hive.load.data.owner
property.description: Set the owner of files loaded using load data in managed tables.

property.name: hive.mapred.mode
property.description: Deprecated; use hive.strict.checks.* settings instead.

property.name: hive.map.aggr
property.description: Whether to use map-side aggregation in Hive Group By queries

property.name: hive.groupby.skewindata
property.description: Whether there is skew in data to optimize group by queries

property.name: hive.join.emit.interval
property.description: How many rows in the right-most join operand Hive should buffer before emitting the join result.

property.name: hive.join.cache.size
property.description: How many rows in the joining tables (except the streaming table) should be cached in memory.

property.name: hive.join.inner.residual
property.description: Whether to push non-equi filter predicates within inner joins. This can improve efficiency in the evaluation of certain joins, since we will not be emitting rows which are thrown away by a Filter operator straight away. However, currently vectorization does not support them, thus enabling it is only recommended when vectorization is disabled.

property.name: hive.cbo.enable
property.description: Flag to control enabling Cost Based Optimizations using Calcite framework.

property.name: hive.cbo.cnf.maxnodes
property.description: When converting to conjunctive normal form (CNF), fail ifthe expression exceeds this threshold; the threshold is expressed in terms of number of nodes (leaves andinterior nodes). -1 to not set up a threshold.

property.name: hive.cbo.returnpath.hiveop
property.description: Flag to control calcite plan to hive operator conversion

property.name: hive.cbo.costmodel.extended
property.description: Flag to control enabling the extended cost model based onCPU, IO and cardinality. Otherwise, the cost model is based on cardinality.

property.name: hive.cbo.costmodel.cpu
property.description: Default cost of a comparison

property.name: hive.cbo.costmodel.network
property.description: Default cost of a transferring a byte over network; expressed as multiple of CPU cost

property.name: hive.cbo.costmodel.local.fs.write
property.description: Default cost of writing a byte to local FS; expressed as multiple of NETWORK cost

property.name: hive.cbo.costmodel.local.fs.read
property.description: Default cost of reading a byte from local FS; expressed as multiple of NETWORK cost

property.name: hive.cbo.costmodel.hdfs.write
property.description: Default cost of writing a byte to HDFS; expressed as multiple of Local FS write cost

property.name: hive.cbo.costmodel.hdfs.read
property.description: Default cost of reading a byte from HDFS; expressed as multiple of Local FS read cost

property.name: hive.cbo.show.warnings
property.description: Toggle display of CBO warnings like missing column stats

property.name: hive.transpose.aggr.join
property.description: push aggregates through join

property.name: hive.optimize.semijoin.conversion
property.description: convert group by followed by inner equi join into semijoin

property.name: hive.order.columnalignment
property.description: Flag to control whether we want to try to aligncolumns in operators such as Aggregate or Join so that we try to reduce the number of shuffling stages

property.name: hive.materializedview.rewriting
property.description: Whether to try to rewrite queries using the materialized views enabled for rewriting

property.name: hive.materializedview.rewriting.strategy
property.description: Expects one of [heuristic, costbased]. The strategy that should be used to cost and select the materialized view rewriting. heuristic: Always try to select the plan using the materialized view if rewriting produced one,choosing the plan with lower cost among possible plans containing a materialized view costbased: Fully cost-based strategy, always use plan with lower cost, independently on whether it uses a materialized view or not

property.name: hive.materializedview.rewriting.time.window
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is min if not specified. Time window, specified in seconds, after which outdated materialized views become invalid for automatic query rewriting. For instance, if more time than the value assigned to the property has passed since the materialized view was created or rebuilt, and one of its source tables has changed since, the materialized view will not be considered for rewriting. Default value 0 means that the materialized view cannot be outdated to be used automatically in query rewriting. Value -1 means to skip this check.

property.name: hive.materializedview.rewriting.incremental
property.description: Whether to try to execute incremental rewritings based on outdated materializations and current content of tables. Default value of true effectively amounts to enabling incremental rebuild for the materializations too.

property.name: hive.materializedview.rebuild.incremental
property.description: Whether to try to execute incremental rebuild for the materialized views. Incremental rebuild tries to modify the original materialization contents to reflect the latest changes to the materialized view source tables, instead of rebuilding the contents fully. Incremental rebuild is based on the materialized view algebraic incremental rewriting.

property.name: hive.materializedview.fileformat
property.description: Expects one of [none, textfile, sequencefile, rcfile, orc]. Default file format for CREATE MATERIALIZED VIEW statement

property.name: hive.materializedview.serde
property.description: Default SerDe used for materialized views

property.name: hive.mapjoin.optimized.hashtable
property.description: Whether Hive should use memory-optimized hash table for MapJoin. Only works on Tez and Spark, because memory-optimized hashtable cannot be serialized.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.optimized.hashtable.probe.percent
property.description: Probing space percentage of the optimized hashtable

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hybridgrace.hashtable
property.description: Whether to use hybridgrace hash join as the join method for mapjoin. Tez only.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hybridgrace.memcheckfrequency
property.description: For hybrid grace hash join, how often (how many rows apart) we check if memory is full. This number should be power of 2.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hybridgrace.minwbsize
property.description: For hybrid graceHash join, the minimum write buffer size used by optimized hashtable. Default is 512 KB.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hybridgrace.minnumpartitions
property.description: ForHybrid grace hash join, the minimum number of partitions to create.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.optimized.hashtable.wbsize
property.description: Optimized hashtable (see hive.mapjoin.optimized.hashtable) uses a chain of buffers to store data. This is one buffer size. HT may be slightly faster if this is larger, but for small joins unnecessary memory will be allocated and then trimmed.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.hybridgrace.bloomfilter
property.description: Whether to use BloomFilter in Hybrid grace hash join to minimize unnecessary spilling.

property.name: hive.smbjoin.cache.rows
property.description: How many rows with the same key value should be cached in memory per smb joined table.

property.name: hive.groupby.mapaggr.checkinterval
property.description: Number of rows after which size of the grouping keys/aggregation classes is performed

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.percentmemory
property.description: Portion of total memory to be used by map-side group aggregation hash table

property.name: hive.mapjoin.followby.map.aggr.hash.percentmemory
property.description: Portion of total memory to be used by map-side group aggregation hash table, when this group by is followed by map join

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.force.flush.memory.threshold
property.description: The max memory to be used by map-side group aggregation hash table. If the memory usage is higher than this number, force to flush data

property.name: hive.map.aggr.hash.min.reduction
property.description: Hash aggregation will be turned off if the ratio between hash table size and input rows is bigger than this number. Set to 1 to make sure hash aggregation is never turned off.

property.name: hive.multigroupby.singlereducer
property.description: Whether to optimize multi group by query to generate single M/R job plan. If the multi group by query has common group by keys, it will be optimized to generate single M/R job.

property.name: hive.map.groupby.sorted
property.description: If the bucketing/sorting properties of the table exactly match the grouping key, whether to perform the group by in the mapper by using BucketizedHiveInputFormat. The only downside to this is that it limits the number of mappers to the number of files.

property.name: hive.groupby.position.alias
property.description: Whether to enable using Column Position Alias in Group By

property.name: hive.orderby.position.alias
property.description: Whether to enable using Column Position Alias in Order By

property.name: hive.groupby.orderby.position.alias
property.description: Whether to enable using Column Position Alias in Group By or Order By (deprecated). Use hive.orderby.position.alias or hive.groupby.position.alias instead

property.name: hive.new.job.grouping.set.cardinality
property.description:
Whether a new map-reduce job should be launched for grouping sets/rollups/cubes. For a query like: select a, b, c, count(1) from T group by a, b, c with rollup; 4 rows are created per row: (a, b, c), (a, b, null), (a, null, null), (null, null, null). This can lead to explosion across map-reduce boundary if the cardinality of T is very high, and map-side aggregation does not do a very good job.
This parameter decides if Hive should add an additional map-reduce job. If the grouping set cardinality (4 in the example above), is more than this value, a new MR job is added under the assumption that the original group by will reduce the data size.

property.name: hive.groupby.limit.extrastep
property.description: This parameter decides if Hive should create new MR job for sorting final output

property.name: hive.exec.copyfile.maxnumfiles
property.description: Maximum number of files Hive uses to do sequential HDFS copies between directories.Distributed copies (distcp) will be used instead for larger numbers of files so that copies can be done faster.

property.name: hive.exec.copyfile.maxsize
property.description: Maximum file size (in bytes) that Hive uses to do single HDFS copies between directories.Distributed copies (distcp) will be used instead for bigger files so that copies can be done faster.

property.name: hive.udtf.auto.progress
property.description: Whether Hive should automatically send progress information to TaskTracker when using UDTF's to prevent the task getting killed because of inactivity. Users should be cautious because this may prevent TaskTracker from killing tasks with infinite loops.

property.name: hive.default.fileformat
property.description: Expects one of [textfile, sequencefile, rcfile, orc, parquet]. Default file format for CREATE TABLE statement. Users can explicitly override it by CREATE TABLE ... STORED AS [FORMAT]

property.name: hive.default.fileformat.managed
property.description: Expects one of [none, textfile, sequencefile, rcfile, orc, parquet]. Default file format for CREATE TABLE statement applied to managed tables only. External tables will be created with format specified by hive.default.fileformat. Leaving this null will result in using hive.default.fileformat for all tables.

property.name: hive.query.result.fileformat
property.description: Expects one of [textfile, sequencefile, rcfile, llap]. Default file format for storing result of the query.

property.name: hive.fileformat.check
property.description: Whether to check file format or not when loading data files

property.name: hive.default.rcfile.serde
property.description: The default SerDe Hive will use for the RCFile format

property.name: hive.default.serde
property.description: The default SerDe Hive will use for storage formats that do not specify a SerDe.

property.name: hive.serdes.using.metastore.for.schema
property.description: SerDes retrieving schema from metastore. This is an internal parameter.

property.name: hive.legacy.schema.for.all.serdes
property.description: A backward compatibility setting for external metastore users that do not handle hive.serdes.using.metastore.for.schema correctly. This may be removed at any time.

property.name: hive.querylog.location
property.description: Location of Hive run time structured log file

property.name: hive.querylog.enable.plan.progress
property.description: Whether to log the plan's progress every time a job's progress is checked. These logs are written to the location specified by hive.querylog.location

property.name: hive.querylog.plan.progress.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. The interval to wait between logging the plan's progress. If there is a whole number percentage change in the progress of the mappers or the reducers, the progress is logged regardless of this value. The actual interval will be the ceiling of (this value divided by the value of hive.exec.counters.pull.interval) multiplied by the value of hive.exec.counters.pull.interval I.e. if it is not divide evenly by the value of hive.exec.counters.pull.interval it will be logged less frequently than specified. This only has an effect if hive.querylog.enable.plan.progress is set to true.

property.name: hive.script.serde
property.description: The default SerDe for transmitting input data to and reading output data from the user scripts.

property.name: hive.script.recordreader
property.description: The default record reader for reading data from the user scripts.

property.name: hive.script.recordwriter
property.description: The default record writer for writing data to the user scripts.

property.name: hive.transform.escape.input
property.description: This adds an option to escape special chars (newlines, carriage returns and tabs) when they are passed to the user script. This is useful if the Hive tables can contain data that contains special characters.

property.name: hive.binary.record.max.length
property.description: Read from a binary stream and treat each hive.binary.record.max.length bytes as a record. The last record before the end of stream can have less than hive.binary.record.max.length bytes

property.name: hive.mapred.local.mem
property.description: mapper/reducer memory in local mode

property.name: hive.mapjoin.smalltable.filesize
property.description: The threshold for the input file size of the small tables; if the file size is smaller than this threshold, it will try to convert the common join into map join

property.name: hive.exec.schema.evolution
property.description: Use schema evolution to convert self-describing file format's data to the schema desired by the reader.

property.name: hive.transactional.events.mem
property.description: Vectorized ACID readers can often load all the delete events from all the delete deltas into memory to optimize for performance. To prevent out-of-memory errors, this is a rough heuristic that limits the total number of delete events that can be loaded into memory at once. Roughly it has been set to 10 million delete events per bucket (~160 MB).

property.name: hive.sample.seednumber
property.description: A number used to percentage sampling. By changing this number, user will change the subsets of data sampled.

property.name: hive.test.mode
property.description: Whether Hive is running in test mode. If yes, it turns on sampling and prefixes the output tablename.

property.name: hive.exim.test.mode
property.description: The subset of test mode that only enables custom path handling for ExIm.

property.name: hive.test.mode.prefix
property.description: In test mode, specifies prefixes for the output table

property.name: hive.test.mode.samplefreq
property.description: In test mode, specifies sampling frequency for table, which is not bucketed, For example, the following query: INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE dest SELECT col1 from src would be converted to INSERT OVERWRITE TABLE test_dest SELECT col1 from src TABLESAMPLE (BUCKET 1 out of 32 on rand(1))

property.name: hive.test.mode.nosamplelist
property.description: In test mode, specifies comma separated table names which would not apply sampling

property.name: hive.test.dummystats.aggregator
property.description: internal variable for test

property.name: hive.test.dummystats.publisher
property.description: internal variable for test

property.name: hive.test.currenttimestamp
property.description: current timestamp for test

property.name: hive.test.rollbacktxn
property.description: For testing only. Will mark every ACID transaction aborted

property.name: hive.test.fail.compaction
property.description: For testing only. Will cause CompactorMR to fail.

property.name: hive.test.fail.heartbeater
property.description: For testing only. Will cause Heartbeater to fail.

property.name: hive.test.bucketcodec.version
property.description: For testing only. Will make ACID subsystem write RecordIdentifier.bucketId in specified format

property.name: hive.merge.mapfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a map-only job

property.name: hive.merge.mapredfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a map-reduce job

property.name: hive.merge.tezfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a Tez DAG

property.name: hive.merge.sparkfiles
property.description: Merge small files at the end of a Spark DAG Transformation

property.name: hive.merge.size.per.task
property.description: Size of merged files at the end of the job

property.name: hive.merge.smallfiles.avgsize
property.description: When the average output file size of a job is less than this number, Hive will start an additional map-reduce job to merge the output files into bigger files. This is only done for map-only jobs if hive.merge.mapfiles is true, and for map-reduce jobs if hive.merge.mapredfiles is true.

property.name: hive.merge.orcfile.stripe.level
property.description: When hive.merge.mapfiles, hive.merge.mapredfiles or hive.merge.tezfiles is enabled while writing a table with ORC file format, enabling this config will do stripe-level fast merge for small ORC files. Note that enabling this config will not honor the padding tolerance config (hive.exec.orc.block.padding.tolerance).

property.name: hive.use.orc.codec.pool
property.description: Whether to use codec pool in ORC. Disable if there are bugs with codec reuse.

property.name: hive.exec.rcfile.use.explicit.header
property.description: If this is set the header for RCFiles will simply be RCF. If this is not set the header will be that borrowed from sequence files, e.g. SEQ- followed by the input and output RCFile formats.

property.name: parquet.memory.pool.ratio
property.description: Maximum fraction of heap that can be used by Parquet file writers in one task. It is for avoiding OutOfMemory error in tasks. Work with Parquet 1.6.0 and above. This config parameter is defined in Parquet, so that it does not start with 'hive.'.

property.name: hive.parquet.timestamp.skip.conversion
property.description: Current Hive implementation of parquet stores timestamps to UTC, this flag allows skipping of the conversionon reading parquet files from other tools

property.name: hive.int.timestamp.conversion.in.seconds
property.description: Boolean/tinyint/smallint/int/bigint value is interpreted as milliseconds during the timestamp conversion. Set this flag to true to interpret the value as seconds to be consistent with float/double.

property.name: hive.exec.orc.base.delta.ratio
property.description: The ratio of base writer and delta writer in terms of STRIPE_SIZE and BUFFER_SIZE.

property.name: hive.exec.orc.delta.streaming.optimizations.enabled
property.description: Whether to enable streaming optimizations for ORC delta files. This will disable ORC's internal indexes, disable compression, enable fast encoding and disable dictionary encoding.

property.name: hive.exec.orc.split.strategy
property.description: Expects one of [hybrid, bi, etl]. This is not a user level config. BI strategy is used when the requirement is to spend less time in split generation as opposed to query execution (split generation does not read or cache file footers). ETL strategy is used when spending little more time in split generation is acceptable (split generation reads and caches file footers). HYBRID chooses between the above strategies based on heuristics.

property.name: hive.streaming.auto.flush.enabled
property.description: Whether to enable memory monitoring and automatic flushing of open record updaters during streaming ingest. This is an expert level setting and disabling this may have severe performance impact under memory pressure.

property.name: hive.heap.memory.monitor.usage.threshold
property.description: Hive streaming does automatic memory management across all open record writers. This threshold will let the memory monitor take an action (flush open files) when heap memory usage exceeded this threshold.

property.name: hive.streaming.auto.flush.check.interval.size
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). Hive streaming ingest has auto flush mechanism to flush all open record updaters under memory pressure. When memory usage exceed hive.heap.memory.monitor.default.usage.threshold, the auto-flush mechanism will wait until this size (default 100Mb) of records are ingested before triggering flush.

property.name: hive.classloader.shade.prefix
property.description: During reflective instantiation of a class (input, output formats, serde etc.), when classloader throws ClassNotFoundException, as a fallback this shade prefix will be used before class reference and retried.

property.name: hive.orc.splits.ms.footer.cache.enabled
property.description: Whether to enable using file metadata cache in metastore for ORC file footers.

property.name: hive.orc.splits.ms.footer.cache.ppd.enabled
property.description: Whether to enable file footer cache PPD (hive.orc.splits.ms.footer.cache.enabled must also be set to true for this to work).

property.name: hive.orc.splits.include.file.footer
property.description: If turned on splits generated by orc will include metadata about the stripes in the file. This data is read remotely (from the client or HS2 machine) and sent to all the tasks.

property.name: hive.orc.splits.directory.batch.ms
property.description: How long, in ms, to wait to batch input directories for processing during ORC split generation. 0 means process directories individually. This can increase the number of metastore calls if metastore metadata cache is used.

property.name: hive.orc.splits.include.fileid
property.description: Include file ID in splits on file systems that support it.

property.name: hive.orc.splits.allow.synthetic.fileid
property.description: Allow synthetic file ID in splits on file systems that don't have a native one.

property.name: hive.orc.cache.stripe.details.mem.size
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). Maximum size of orc splits cached in the client.

property.name: hive.orc.compute.splits.num.threads
property.description: How many threads orc should use to create splits in parallel.

property.name: hive.orc.cache.use.soft.references
property.description: By default, the cache that ORC input format uses to store orc file footer use hard references for the cached object. Setting this to true can help avoid out of memory issues under memory pressure (in some cases) at the cost of slight unpredictability in overall query performance.

property.name: hive.io.sarg.cache.max.weight.mb
property.description: The max weight allowed for the SearchArgument Cache. By default, the cache allows a max-weight of 10MB, after which entries will be evicted.

property.name: hive.lazysimple.extended_boolean_literal
property.description: LazySimpleSerde uses this property to determine if it treats 'T', 't', 'F', 'f', '1', and '0' as extended, legal boolean literal, in addition to 'TRUE' and 'FALSE'. The default is false, which means only 'TRUE' and 'FALSE' are treated as legal boolean literal.

property.name: hive.optimize.skewjoin
property.description: Whether to enable skew join optimization. The algorithm is as follows: At runtime, detect the keys with a large skew. Instead of processing those keys, store them temporarily in an HDFS directory. In a follow-up map-reduce job, process those skewed keys. The same key need not be skewed for all the tables, and so, the follow-up map-reduce job (for the skewed keys) would be much faster, since it would be a map-join.

property.name: hive.optimize.dynamic.partition.hashjoin
property.description: Whether to enable dynamically partitioned hash join optimization. This setting is also dependent on enabling hive.auto.convert.join

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join
property.description: Whether Hive enables the optimization about converting common join into mapjoin based on the input file size

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask
property.description: Whether Hive enables the optimization about converting common join into mapjoin based on the input file size. If this parameter is on, and the sum of size for n-1 of the tables/partitions for a n-way join is smaller than the specified size, the join is directly converted to a mapjoin (there is no conditional task).

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask.size
property.description: If hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask is off, this parameter does not take affect. However, if it is on, and the sum of size for n-1 of the tables/partitions for a n-way join is smaller than this size, the join is directly converted to a mapjoin(there is no conditional task). The default is 10MB

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join.use.nonstaged
property.description: For conditional joins, if input stream from a small alias can be directly applied to join operator without filtering or projection, the alias need not to be pre-staged in distributed cache via mapred local task. Currently, this is not working with vectorization or tez execution engine.

property.name: hive.skewjoin.key
property.description: Determine if we get a skew key in join. If we see more than the specified number of rows with the same key in join operator, we think the key as a skew join key.

property.name: hive.skewjoin.mapjoin.map.tasks
property.description: Determine the number of map task used in the follow up map join job for a skew join. It should be used together with hive.skewjoin.mapjoin.min.split to perform a fine grained control.

property.name: hive.skewjoin.mapjoin.min.split
property.description: Determine the number of map task at most used in the follow up map join job for a skew join by specifying the minimum split size. It should be used together with hive.skewjoin.mapjoin.map.tasks to perform a fine grained control.

property.name: hive.heartbeat.interval
property.description: Send a heartbeat after this interval - used by mapjoin and filter operators

property.name: hive.limit.row.max.size
property.description: When trying a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT, how much size we need to guarantee each row to have at least.

property.name: hive.limit.optimize.limit.file
property.description: When trying a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT, maximum number of files we can sample.

property.name: hive.limit.optimize.enable
property.description: Whether to enable to optimization to trying a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT first.

property.name: hive.limit.optimize.fetch.max
property.description: Maximum number of rows allowed for a smaller subset of data for simple LIMIT, if it is a fetch query. Insert queries are not restricted by this limit.

property.name: hive.limit.pushdown.memory.usage
property.description: Expects value between 0.0f and 1.0f. The fraction of available memory to be used for buffering rows in Reducesink operator for limit pushdown optimization.

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join.hashtable.max.entries
property.description: If hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask is off, this parameter does not take affect. However, if it is on, and the predicted number of entries in hashtable for a given join input is larger than this number, the join will not be converted to a mapjoin. The value "-1" means no limit.

property.name: hive.auto.convert.join.shuffle.max.size
property.description: If hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask is off, this parameter does not take affect. However, if it is on, and the predicted size of the larger input for a given join is greater than this number, the join will not be converted to a dynamically partitioned hash join. The value "-1" means no limit.

property.name: hive.hashtable.key.count.adjustment
property.description: Adjustment to mapjoin hashtable size derived from table and column statistics; the estimate of the number of keys is divided by this value. If the value is 0, statistics are not usedand hive.hashtable.initialCapacity is used instead.

property.name: hive.hashtable.initialCapacity
property.description: Initial capacity of mapjoin hashtable if statistics are absent, or if hive.hashtable.key.count.adjustment is set to 0

property.name: hive.mapjoin.followby.gby.localtask.max.memory.usage
property.description: This number means how much memory the local task can take to hold the key/value into an in-memory hash table when this map join is followed by a group by. If the local task's memory usage is more than this number, the local task will abort by itself. It means the data of the small table is too large to be held in memory.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.localtask.max.memory.usage
property.description: This number means how much memory the local task can take to hold the key/value into an in-memory hash table. If the local task's memory usage is more than this number, the local task will abort by itself. It means the data of the small table is too large to be held in memory.

property.name: hive.mapjoin.check.memory.rows
property.description: The number means after how many rows processed it needs to check the memory usage

property.name: hive.input.format
property.description: The default input format. Set this to HiveInputFormat if you encounter problems with CombineHiveInputFormat.

property.name: hive.tez.input.format
property.description: The default input format for tez. Tez groups splits in the AM.

property.name: hive.tez.container.size
property.description: By default Tez will spawn containers of the size of a mapper. This can be used to overwrite.

property.name: hive.tez.cpu.vcores
property.description: By default Tez will ask for however many cpus map-reduce is configured to use per container. This can be used to overwrite.

property.name: hive.tez.java.opts
property.description: By default Tez will use the Java options from map tasks. This can be used to overwrite.

property.name: hive.tez.log.level
property.description: The log level to use for tasks executing as part of the DAG. Used only if hive.tez.java.opts is used to configure Java options.

property.name: hive.tez.hs2.user.access
property.description: Whether to grant access to the hs2/hive user for queries

property.name: hive.query.name
property.description: This named is used by Tez to set the dag name. This name in turn will appear on the Tez UI representing the work that was done. Used by Spark to set the query name, will show up in the Spark UI.

property.name: hive.optimize.bucketingsorting
property.description: Don't create a reducer for enforcing bucketing/sorting for queries of the form: insert overwrite table T2 select * from T1; where T1 and T2 are bucketed/sorted by the same keys into the same number of buckets.

property.name: hive.enforce.sortmergebucketmapjoin
property.description: If the user asked for sort-merge bucketed map-side join, and it cannot be performed, should the query fail or not ?

property.name: hive.enforce.bucketmapjoin
property.description: If the user asked for bucketed map-side join, and it cannot be performed, should the query fail or not ? For example, if the buckets in the tables being joined are not a multiple of each other, bucketed map-side join cannot be performed, and the query will fail if hive.enforce.bucketmapjoin is set to true.

property.name: hive.constraint.notnull.enforce
property.description: Should "IS NOT NULL " constraint be enforced?

property.name: hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join
property.description: Will the join be automatically converted to a sort-merge join, if the joined tables pass the criteria for sort-merge join.

property.name: hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join.reduce.side
property.description: Whether hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join (if enabled) should be applied to reduce side.

property.name: hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join.bigtable.selection.policy
property.description: The policy to choose the big table for automatic conversion to sort-merge join. By default, the table with the largest partitions is assigned the big table. All policies are: . based on position of the table - the leftmost table is selected org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.optimizer.LeftmostBigTableSMJ. . based on total size (all the partitions selected in the query) of the table org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.optimizer.TableSizeBasedBigTableSelectorForAutoSMJ. . based on average size (all the partitions selected in the query) of the table org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.optimizer.AvgPartitionSizeBasedBigTableSelectorForAutoSMJ. New policies can be added in future.

property.name: hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join.to.mapjoin
property.description: If hive.auto.convert.sortmerge.join is set to true, and a join was converted to a sort-merge join, this parameter decides whether each table should be tried as a big table, and effectively a map-join should be tried. That would create a conditional task with n+1 children for a n-way join (1 child for each table as the big table), and the backup task will be the sort-merge join. In some cases, a map-join would be faster than a sort-merge join, if there is no advantage of having the output bucketed and sorted. For example, if a very big sorted and bucketed table with few files (say 10 files) are being joined with a very small sorter and bucketed table with few files (10 files), the sort-merge join will only use 10 mappers, and a simple map-only join might be faster if the complete small table can fit in memory, and a map-join can be performed.

property.name: hive.exec.rowoffset
property.description: Whether to provide the row offset virtual column

property.name: hive.optimize.index.filter
property.description: Whether to enable automatic use of indexes

property.name: hive.optimize.ppd
property.description: Whether to enable predicate pushdown

property.name: hive.optimize.ppd.windowing
property.description: Whether to enable predicate pushdown through windowing

property.name: hive.ppd.recognizetransivity
property.description: Whether to transitively replicate predicate filters over equijoin conditions.

property.name: hive.ppd.remove.duplicatefilters
property.description: During query optimization, filters may be pushed down in the operator tree. If this config is true only pushed down filters remain in the operator tree, and the original filter is removed.
