If this config is false, the original filter is also left in the operator tree at the original place.

property.name: hive.optimize.point.lookup
property.description: Whether to transform OR clauses in Filter operators into IN clauses

property.name: hive.optimize.point.lookup.min
property.description: Minimum number of OR clauses needed to transform into IN clauses

property.name: hive.optimize.countdistinct
property.description: Whether to transform count distinct into two stages

property.name: hive.optimize.partition.columns.separate
property.description: Extract partition columns from IN clauses

property.name: hive.optimize.constant.propagation
property.description: Whether to enable constant propagation optimizer

property.name: hive.optimize.remove.identity.project
property.description: Removes identity project from operator tree

property.name: hive.optimize.metadataonly
property.description: Whether to eliminate scans of the tables from which no columns are selected. Note that, when selecting from empty tables with data files, this can produce incorrect results, so it's disabled by default. It works correctly for normal tables.

property.name: hive.optimize.null.scan
property.description: Dont scan relations which are guaranteed to not generate any rows

property.name: hive.optimize.ppd.storage
property.description: Whether to push predicates down to storage handlers

property.name: hive.optimize.groupby
property.description: Whether to enable the bucketed group by from bucketed partitions/tables.

property.name: hive.optimize.bucketmapjoin
property.description: Whether to try bucket mapjoin

property.name: hive.optimize.bucketmapjoin.sortedmerge
property.description: Whether to try sorted bucket merge map join

property.name: hive.optimize.reducededuplication
property.description: Remove extra map-reduce jobs if the data is already clustered by the same key which needs to be used again. This should always be set to true. Since it is a new feature, it has been made configurable.

property.name: hive.optimize.reducededuplication.min.reducer
property.description: Reduce deduplication merges two RSs by moving key/parts/reducer-num of the child RS to parent RS. That means if reducer-num of the child RS is fixed (order by or forced bucketing) and small, it can make very slow, single MR. The optimization will be automatically disabled if number of reducers would be less than specified value.

property.name: hive.optimize.joinreducededuplication
property.description: Remove extra shuffle/sorting operations after join algorithm selection has been executed. Currently it only works with Apache Tez. This should always be set to true. Since it is a new feature, it has been made configurable.

property.name: hive.optimize.sort.dynamic.partition
property.description: When enabled dynamic partitioning column will be globally sorted. This way we can keep only one record writer open for each partition value in the reducer thereby reducing the memory pressure on reducers.

property.name: hive.optimize.sampling.orderby
property.description: Uses sampling on order-by clause for parallel execution.

property.name: hive.optimize.sampling.orderby.number
property.description: Total number of samples to be obtained.

property.name: hive.optimize.sampling.orderby.percent
property.description: Expects value between 0.0f and 1.0f. Probability with which a row will be chosen.

property.name: hive.remove.orderby.in.subquery
property.description: If set to true, order/sort by without limit in sub queries will be removed.

property.name: hive.optimize.distinct.rewrite
property.description: When applicable this optimization rewrites distinct aggregates from a single stage to multi-stage aggregation. This may not be optimal in all cases. Ideally, whether to trigger it or not should be cost based decision. Until Hive formalizes cost model for this, this is config driven.

property.name: hive.optimize.union.remove
property.description:
Whether to remove the union and push the operators between union and the filesink above union. This avoids an extra scan of the output by union. This is independently useful for union queries, and specially useful when hive.optimize.skewjoin.compiletime is set to true, since an extra union is inserted.
The merge is triggered if either of hive.merge.mapfiles or hive.merge.mapredfiles is set to true. If the user has set hive.merge.mapfiles to true and hive.merge.mapredfiles to false, the idea was the number of reducers are few, so the number of files anyway are small. However, with this optimization, we are increasing the number of files possibly by a big margin. So, we merge aggressively.

property.name: hive.optimize.correlation
property.description: exploit intra-query correlations.

property.name: hive.optimize.limittranspose
property.description: Whether to push a limit through left/right outer join or union. If the value is true and the size of the outer input is reduced enough (as specified in hive.optimize.limittranspose.reduction), the limit is pushed to the outer input or union; to remain semantically correct, the limit is kept on top of the join or the union too.

property.name: hive.optimize.limittranspose.reductionpercentage
property.description: When hive.optimize.limittranspose is true, this variable specifies the minimal reduction of the size of the outer input of the join or input of the union that we should get in order to apply the rule.

property.name: hive.optimize.limittranspose.reductiontuples
property.description: When hive.optimize.limittranspose is true, this variable specifies the minimal reduction in the number of tuples of the outer input of the join or the input of the union that you should get in order to apply the rule.

property.name: hive.optimize.filter.stats.reduction
property.description: Whether to simplify comparison expressions in filter operators using column stats

property.name: hive.optimize.skewjoin.compiletime
property.description:
Whether to create a separate plan for skewed keys for the tables in the join. This is based on the skewed keys stored in the metadata. At compile time, the plan is broken into different joins: one for the skewed keys, and the other for the remaining keys. And then, a union is performed for the 2 joins generated above. So unless the same skewed key is present in both the joined tables, the join for the skewed key will be performed as a map-side join.
The main difference between this parameter and hive.optimize.skewjoin is that this parameter uses the skew information stored in the metastore to optimize the plan at compile time itself. If there is no skew information in the metadata, this parameter will not have any affect. Both hive.optimize.skewjoin.compiletime and hive.optimize.skewjoin should be set to true. Ideally, hive.optimize.skewjoin should be renamed as hive.optimize.skewjoin.runtime, but not doing so for backward compatibility.
If the skew information is correctly stored in the metadata, hive.optimize.skewjoin.compiletime would change the query plan to take care of it, and hive.optimize.skewjoin will be a no-op.

property.name: hive.optimize.shared.work
property.description: Whether to enable shared work optimizer. The optimizer finds scan operator over the same table and follow-up operators in the query plan and merges them if they meet some preconditions. Tez only.

property.name: hive.optimize.shared.work.extended
property.description: Whether to enable shared work extended optimizer. The optimizer tries to merge equal operators after a work boundary after shared work optimizer has been executed. Requires hive.optimize.shared.work to be set to true. Tez only.

property.name: hive.combine.equivalent.work.optimization
property.description: Whether to combine equivalent work objects during physical optimization. This optimization looks for equivalent work objects and combines them if they meet certain preconditions. Spark only.

property.name: hive.optimize.remove.sq_count_check
property.description: Whether to remove an extra join with sq_count_check for scalar subqueries with constant group by keys.

property.name: hive.optimize.update.table.properties.from.serde
property.description: Whether to update table-properties by initializing tables' SerDe instances during logical-optimization. By doing so, certain SerDe classes (like AvroSerDe) can pre-calculate table-specific information, and store it in table-properties, to be used later in the SerDe, while running the job.

property.name: hive.optimize.update.table.properties.from.serde.list
property.description: The comma-separated list of SerDe classes that are considered when enhancing table-properties during logical optimization.

property.name: hive.optimize.cte.materialize.threshold
property.description: If the number of references to a CTE clause exceeds this threshold, Hive will materialize it before executing the main query block. -1 will disable this feature.

property.name: hive.stats.estimate
property.description: Estimate statistics in absence of statistics.

property.name: hive.stats.ndv.estimate.percent
property.description: This many percentage of rows will be estimated as count distinct in absence of statistics.

property.name: hive.stats.num.nulls.estimate.percent
property.description: This many percentage of rows will be estimated as number of nulls in absence of statistics.

property.name: hive.stats.autogather
property.description: A flag to gather statistics (only basic) automatically during the INSERT OVERWRITE command.

property.name: hive.stats.column.autogather
property.description: A flag to gather column statistics automatically.

property.name: hive.stats.dbclass
property.description: Expects one of the pattern in [custom, fs]. The storage that stores temporary Hive statistics. In filesystem based statistics collection ('fs'), each task writes statistics it has collected in a file on the filesystem, which will be aggregated after the job has finished. Supported values are fs (filesystem) and custom as defined in StatsSetupConst.java.

property.name: hive.stats.default.publisher
property.description: The Java class (implementing the StatsPublisher interface) that is used by default if hive.stats.dbclass is custom type.

property.name: hive.stats.default.aggregator
property.description: The Java class (implementing the StatsAggregator interface) that is used by default if hive.stats.dbclass is custom type.

property.name: hive.client.stats.counters
property.description: Subset of counters that should be of interest for hive.client.stats.publishers (when one wants to limit their publishing). Non-display names should be used

property.name: hive.stats.reliable
property.description: Whether queries will fail because stats cannot be collected completely accurately. If this is set to true, reading/writing from/into a partition may fail because the stats could not be computed accurately.

property.name: hive.analyze.stmt.collect.partlevel.stats
property.description: analyze table T compute statistics for columns. Queries like these should compute partitionlevel stats for partitioned table even when no part spec is specified.

property.name: hive.stats.gather.num.threads
property.description: Number of threads used by noscan analyze command for partitioned tables. This is applicable only for file formats that implement StatsProvidingRecordReader (like ORC).

property.name: hive.stats.collect.tablekeys
property.description: Whether join and group by keys on tables are derived and maintained in the QueryPlan. This is useful to identify how tables are accessed and to determine if they should be bucketed.

property.name: hive.stats.collect.scancols
property.description: Whether column accesses are tracked in the QueryPlan. This is useful to identify how tables are accessed and to determine if there are wasted columns that can be trimmed.

property.name: hive.stats.ndv.algo
property.description: Expects one of the pattern in [hll, fm]. hll and fm stand for HyperLogLog and FM-sketch, respectively for computing ndv.

property.name: hive.stats.fetch.bitvector
property.description: Whether we fetch bitvector when we compute ndv. Users can turn it off if they want to use old schema

property.name: hive.stats.ndv.error
property.description: Standard error expressed in percentage. Provides a tradeoff between accuracy and compute cost. A lower value for error indicates higher accuracy and a higher compute cost.

property.name: hive.metastore.stats.ndv.tuner
property.description: Provides a tunable parameter between the lower bound and the higher bound of ndv for aggregate ndv across all the partitions. The lower bound is equal to the maximum of ndv of all the partitions. The higher bound is equal to the sum of ndv of all the partitions. Its value should be between 0.0 (i.e., choose lower bound) and 1.0 (i.e., choose higher bound)

property.name: hive.metastore.stats.ndv.densityfunction
property.description: Whether to use density function to estimate the NDV for the whole table based on the NDV of partitions

property.name: hive.stats.max.variable.length
property.description: To estimate the size of data flowing through operators in Hive/Tez(for reducer estimation etc.), average row size is multiplied with the total number of rows coming out of each operator. Average row size is computed from average column size of all columns in the row. In the absence of column statistics, for variable length columns (like string, bytes etc.), this value will be used. For fixed length columns their corresponding Java equivalent sizes are used (float - 4 bytes, double - 8 bytes etc.).

property.name: hive.stats.list.num.entries
property.description: To estimate the size of data flowing through operators in Hive/Tez(for reducer estimation etc.), average row size is multiplied with the total number of rows coming out of each operator. Average row size is computed from average column size of all columns in the row. In the absence of column statistics and for variable length complex columns like list, the average number of entries/values can be specified using this config.

property.name: hive.stats.map.num.entries
property.description: To estimate the size of data flowing through operators in Hive/Tez(for reducer estimation etc.), average row size is multiplied with the total number of rows coming out of each operator. Average row size is computed from average column size of all columns in the row. In the absence of column statistics and for variable length complex columns like map, the average number of entries/values can be specified using this config.

property.name: hive.stats.fetch.column.stats
property.description: Annotation of operator tree with statistics information requires column statistics. Column statistics are fetched from metastore. Fetching column statistics for each needed column can be expensive when the number of columns is high. This flag can be used to disable fetching of column statistics from metastore.

property.name: hive.stats.join.factor
property.description: Hive/Tez optimizer estimates the data size flowing through each of the operators. JOIN operator uses column statistics to estimate the number of rows flowing out of it and hence the data size. In the absence of column statistics, this factor determines the amount of rows that flows out of JOIN operator.

property.name: hive.stats.correlated.multi.key.joins
property.description: When estimating output rows for a join involving multiple columns, the default behavior assumesthe columns are independent. Setting this flag to true will cause the estimator to assumethe columns are correlated.

property.name: hive.stats.deserialization.factor
property.description: Hive/Tez optimizer estimates the data size flowing through each of the operators. In the absence of basic statistics like number of rows and data size, file size is used to estimate the number of rows and data size. Since files in tables/partitions are serialized (and optionally compressed) the estimates of number of rows and data size cannot be reliably determined. This factor is multiplied with the file size to account for serialization and compression.

property.name: hive.stats.filter.in.factor
property.description: Currently column distribution is assumed to be uniform. This can lead to overestimation/underestimation in the number of rows filtered by a certain operator, which in turn might lead to overprovision or underprovision of resources. This factor is applied to the cardinality estimation of IN clauses in filter operators.

property.name: hive.stats.filter.in.min.ratio
property.description: Output estimation of an IN filter can't be lower than this ratio

property.name: hive.support.concurrency
property.description: Whether Hive supports concurrency control or not. A ZooKeeper instance must be up and running when using zookeeper Hive lock manager

property.name: hive.enforce.bucketing
property.description: Whether Hive supports concurrency control or not. A ZooKeeper instance must be up and running when using zookeeper Hive lock manager

property.name: hive.lock.numretries
property.description: The number of times you want to try to get all the locks

property.name: hive.unlock.numretries
property.description: The number of times you want to retry to do one unlock

property.name: hive.lock.sleep.between.retries
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. The time should be in between 0 sec (exclusive) and 9223372036854775807 sec (exclusive). The maximum sleep time between various retries

property.name: hive.lock.mapred.only.operation
property.description: This param is to control whether or not only do lock on queries that need to execute at least one mapred job.

property.name: hive.lock.query.string.max.length
property.description: The maximum length of the query string to store in the lock. The default value is 1000000, since the data limit of a znode is 1MB

property.name: hive.mm.allow.originals
property.description: Whether to allow original files in MM tables. Conversion to MM may be expensive if this is set to false, however unless MAPREDUCE-7086 fix is present, queries that read MM tables with original files will fail. The default in Hive 3.0 is false.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.quorum
property.description: List of ZooKeeper servers to talk to. This is needed for: 1. Read/write locks - when hive.lock.manager is set to org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.lockmgr.zookeeper.ZooKeeperHiveLockManager, 2. When HiveServer2 supports service discovery via Zookeeper. 3. For delegation token storage if zookeeper store is used, if hive.cluster.delegation.token.store.zookeeper.connectString is not set 4. LLAP daemon registry service 5. Leader selection for privilege synchronizer

property.name: hive.zookeeper.client.port
property.description: The port of ZooKeeper servers to talk to. If the list of Zookeeper servers specified in hive.zookeeper.quorum does not contain port numbers, this value is used.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.session.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. ZooKeeper client's session timeout (in milliseconds). The client is disconnected, and as a result, all locks released, if a heartbeat is not sent in the timeout.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.connection.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. ZooKeeper client's connection timeout in seconds. Connection timeout * hive.zookeeper.connection.max.retries with exponential backoff is when curator client deems connection is lost to zookeeper.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.namespace
property.description: The parent node under which all ZooKeeper nodes are created.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.clean.extra.nodes
property.description: Clean extra nodes at the end of the session.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.connection.max.retries
property.description: Max number of times to retry when connecting to the ZooKeeper server.

property.name: hive.zookeeper.connection.basesleeptime
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Initial amount of time (in milliseconds) to wait between retries when connecting to the ZooKeeper server when using ExponentialBackoffRetry policy.

property.name: hive.txn.manager
property.description: Set to org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.lockmgr.DbTxnManager as part of turning on Hive transactions, which also requires appropriate settings for hive.compactor.initiator.on, hive.compactor.worker.threads, hive.support.concurrency (true), and hive.exec.dynamic.partition.mode (nonstrict). The default DummyTxnManager replicates pre-Hive-0.13 behavior and provides no transactions.

property.name: hive.txn.strict.locking.mode
property.description: In strict mode non-ACID resources use standard R/W lock semantics, e.g. INSERT will acquire exclusive lock. In nonstrict mode, for non-ACID resources, INSERT will only acquire shared lock, which allows two concurrent writes to the same partition but still lets lock manager prevent DROP TABLE etc. when the table is being written to

property.name: hive.txn.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. time after which transactions are declared aborted if the client has not sent a heartbeat.

property.name: hive.txn.heartbeat.threadpool.size
property.description: The number of threads to use for heartbeating. For Hive CLI, 1 is enough. For HiveServer2, we need a few

property.name: hive.txn.manager.dump.lock.state.on.acquire.timeout
property.description: Set this to true so that when attempt to acquire a lock on resource times out, the current state of the lock manager is dumped to log file. This is for debugging. See also hive.lock.numretries and hive.lock.sleep.between.retries.

property.name: hive.max.open.txns
property.description: Maximum number of open transactions. If current open transactions reach this limit, future open transaction requests will be rejected, until this number goes below the limit.

property.name: hive.count.open.txns.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Time in seconds between checks to count open transactions.

property.name: hive.txn.max.open.batch
property.description: Maximum number of transactions that can be fetched in one call to open_txns(). This controls how many transactions streaming agents such as Flume or Storm open simultaneously. The streaming agent then writes that number of entries into a single file (per Flume agent or Storm bolt). Thus increasing this value decreases the number of delta files created by streaming agents. But it also increases the number of open transactions that Hive has to track at any given time, which may negatively affect read performance.

property.name: hive.txn.retryable.sqlex.regex
property.description: Comma separated list of regular expression patterns for SQL state, error code, and error message of retryable SQLExceptions, that's suitable for the metastore DB. For example: Can't serialize.*,40001$,^Deadlock,.*ORA-08176.* The string that the regex will be matched against is of the following form, where ex is a SQLException: ex.getMessage() + " (SQLState=" + ex.getSQLState() + ", ErrorCode=" + ex.getErrorCode() + ")"

property.name: hive.compactor.initiator.on
property.description: Whether to run the initiator and cleaner threads on this metastore instance or not. Set this to true on one instance of the Thrift metastore service as part of turning on Hive transactions. For a complete list of parameters required for turning on transactions, see hive.txn.manager.

property.name: hive.compactor.worker.threads
property.description: How many compactor worker threads to run on this metastore instance. Set this to a positive number on one or more instances of the Thrift metastore service as part of turning on Hive transactions. For a complete list of parameters required for turning on transactions, see hive.txn.manager. Worker threads spawn MapReduce jobs to do compactions. They do not do the compactions themselves. Increasing the number of worker threads will decrease the time it takes tables or partitions to be compacted once they are determined to need compaction. It will also increase the background load on the Hadoop cluster as more MapReduce jobs will be running in the background.

property.name: hive.compactor.worker.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Time in seconds after which a compaction job will be declared failed and the compaction re-queued.

property.name: hive.compactor.check.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Time in seconds between checks to see if any tables or partitions need to be compacted. This should be kept high because each check for compaction requires many calls against the NameNode. Decreasing this value will reduce the time it takes for compaction to be started for a table or partition that requires compaction. However, checking if compaction is needed requires several calls to the NameNode for each table or partition that has had a transaction done on it since the last major compaction. So decreasing this value will increase the load on the NameNode.

property.name: hive.compactor.delta.num.threshold
property.description: Number of delta directories in a table or partition that will trigger a minor compaction.

property.name: hive.compactor.delta.pct.threshold
property.description: Percentage (fractional) size of the delta files relative to the base that will trigger a major compaction. (1.0 = 100%, so the default 0.1 = 10%.)

property.name: hive.compactor.max.num.delta
property.description: Maximum number of delta files that the compactor will attempt to handle in a single job.

property.name: hive.compactor.abortedtxn.threshold
property.description: Number of aborted transactions involving a given table or partition that will trigger a major compaction.

property.name: hive.compactor.initiator.failed.compacts.threshold
property.description: Expects value between 1 and 20. Number of consecutive compaction failures (per table/partition) after which automatic compactions will not be scheduled any more. Note that this must be less than hive.compactor.history.retention.failed.

property.name: hive.compactor.cleaner.run.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Time between runs of the cleaner thread

property.name: hive.compactor.job.queue
property.description: Used to specify name of Hadoop queue to which Compaction jobs will be submitted. Set to empty string to let Hadoop choose the queue.

property.name: hive.transactional.concatenate.noblock
property.description: Will cause 'alter table T concatenate' to be non-blocking

property.name: hive.compactor.compact.insert.only
property.description: Whether the compactor should compact insert-only tables. A safety switch.

property.name: hive.compactor.history.retention.succeeded
property.description: Expects value between 0 and 100. Determines how many successful compaction records will be retained in compaction history for a given table/partition.

property.name: hive.compactor.history.retention.failed
property.description: Expects value between 0 and 100. Determines how many failed compaction records will be retained in compaction history for a given table/partition.

property.name: hive.compactor.history.retention.attempted
property.description: Expects value between 0 and 100. Determines how many attempted compaction records will be retained in compaction history for a given table/partition.

property.name: hive.compactor.history.reaper.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Determines how often compaction history reaper runs

property.name: hive.timedout.txn.reaper.start
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Time delay of 1st reaper run after metastore start

property.name: hive.timedout.txn.reaper.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Time interval describing how often the reaper runs

property.name: hive.writeset.reaper.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Frequency of WriteSet reaper runs

property.name: hive.merge.cardinality.check
property.description: Set to true to ensure that each SQL Merge statement ensures that for each row in the target table there is at most 1 matching row in the source table per SQL Specification.

property.name: hive.arrow.root.allocator.limit
property.description: Arrow root allocator memory size limitation in bytes.

property.name: hive.arrow.batch.size
property.description: The number of rows sent in one Arrow batch.

property.name: hive.druid.indexer.segments.granularity
property.description: Expects one of the pattern in [YEAR, MONTH, WEEK, DAY, HOUR, MINUTE, SECOND]. Granularity for the segments created by the Druid storage handler

property.name: hive.druid.indexer.partition.size.max
property.description: Maximum number of records per segment partition

property.name: hive.druid.indexer.memory.rownum.max
property.description: Maximum number of records in memory while storing data in Druid

property.name: hive.druid.broker.address.default
property.description: Address of the Druid broker. If we are querying Druid from Hive, this address needs to be declared

property.name: hive.druid.coordinator.address.default
property.description: Address of the Druid coordinator. It is used to check the load status of newly created segments

property.name: hive.druid.overlord.address.default
property.description: Address of the Druid overlord. It is used to submit indexing tasks to druid.

property.name: hive.druid.select.threshold
property.description: Takes only effect when hive.druid.select.distribute is set to false. When we can split a Select query, this is the maximum number of rows that we try to retrieve per query. In order to do that, we obtain the estimated size for the complete result. If the number of records of the query results is larger than this threshold, we split the query in total number of rows/threshold parts across the time dimension. Note that we assume the records to be split uniformly across the time dimension.

property.name: hive.druid.http.numConnection
property.description: Number of connections used by the HTTP client.

property.name: hive.druid.http.read.timeout
property.description: Read timeout period for the HTTP client in ISO8601 format (for example P2W, P3M, PT1H30M, PT0.750S), default is period of 1 minute.

property.name: hive.druid.sleep.time
property.description: Sleep time between retries in ISO8601 format (for example P2W, P3M, PT1H30M, PT0.750S), default is period of 10 seconds.

property.name: hive.druid.basePersistDirectory
property.description: Local temporary directory used to persist intermediate indexing state, will default to JVM system property java.io.tmpdir.

property.name: hive.druid.storage.storageDirectory
property.description: druid deep storage location.

property.name: hive.druid.metadata.base
property.description: Default prefix for metadata tables

property.name: hive.druid.metadata.db.type
property.description: Expects one of the pattern in [mysql, postgresql, derby]. Type of the metadata database.

property.name: hive.druid.metadata.username
property.description: Username to connect to Type of the metadata DB.

property.name: hive.druid.metadata.password
property.description: Password to connect to Type of the metadata DB.

property.name: hive.druid.metadata.uri
property.description: URI to connect to the database (for example jdbc:mysql://hostname:port/DBName).

property.name: hive.druid.working.directory
property.description: Default hdfs working directory used to store some intermediate metadata

property.name: hive.druid.maxTries
property.description: Maximum number of retries before giving up

property.name: hive.druid.passiveWaitTimeMs
property.description: Wait time in ms default to 30 seconds.

property.name: hive.druid.bitmap.type
property.description: Expects one of the pattern in [roaring, concise]. Coding algorithm use to encode the bitmaps

property.name: hive.hbase.wal.enabled
property.description: Whether writes to HBase should be forced to the write-ahead log. Disabling this improves HBase write performance at the risk of lost writes in case of a crash.

property.name: hive.hbase.generatehfiles
property.description: True when HBaseStorageHandler should generate hfiles instead of operate against the online table.

property.name: hive.hbase.snapshot.name
property.description: The HBase table snapshot name to use.

property.name: hive.hbase.snapshot.restoredir
property.description: The directory in which to restore the HBase table snapshot.

property.name: hive.archive.enabled
property.description: Whether archiving operations are permitted

property.name: hive.fetch.task.conversion
property.description: Expects one of [none, minimal, more]. Some select queries can be converted to single FETCH task minimizing latency. Currently the query should be single sourced not having any subquery and should not have any aggregations or distincts (which incurs RS), lateral views and joins. 0. none : disable hive.fetch.task.conversion 1. minimal : SELECT STAR, FILTER on partition columns, LIMIT only 2. more : SELECT, FILTER, LIMIT only (support TABLESAMPLE and virtual columns)

property.name: hive.fetch.task.conversion.threshold
property.description: Input threshold for applying hive.fetch.task.conversion. If target table is native, input length is calculated by summation of file lengths. If it's not native, storage handler for the table can optionally implement org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.metadata.InputEstimator interface.

property.name: hive.fetch.task.aggr
property.description: Aggregation queries with no group-by clause (for example, select count(*) from src) execute final aggregations in single reduce task. If this is set true, Hive delegates final aggregation stage to fetch task, possibly decreasing the query time.

property.name: hive.compute.query.using.stats
property.description: When set to true Hive will answer a few queries like count(1) purely using stats stored in metastore. For basic stats collection turn on the config hive.stats.autogather to true. For more advanced stats collection need to run analyze table queries.

property.name: hive.fetch.output.serde
property.description: The SerDe used by FetchTask to serialize the fetch output.

property.name: hive.cache.expr.evaluation
property.description: If true, the evaluation result of a deterministic expression referenced twice or more will be cached. For example, in a filter condition like '.. where key + 10 = 100 or key + 10 = 0' the expression 'key + 10' will be evaluated/cached once and reused for the following expression ('key + 10 = 0'). Currently, this is applied only to expressions in select or filter operators.

property.name: hive.variable.substitute
property.description: This enables substitution using syntax like ${var} ${system:var} and ${env:var}.

property.name: hive.variable.substitute.depth
property.description: The maximum replacements the substitution engine will do.

property.name: hive.conf.validation
property.description: Enables type checking for registered Hive configurations

property.name: hive.security.authorization.enabled
property.description: enable or disable the Hive client authorization

property.name: hive.security.authorization.manager
property.description: The Hive client authorization manager class name. The user defined authorization class should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.HiveAuthorizationProvider.

property.name: hive.security.authenticator.manager
property.description: hive client authenticator manager class name. The user defined authenticator should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.HiveAuthenticationProvider.

property.name: hive.security.metastore.authorization.manager
property.description: Names of authorization manager classes (comma separated) to be used in the metastore for authorization. The user defined authorization class should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.authorization.HiveMetastoreAuthorizationProvider. All authorization manager classes have to successfully authorize the metastore API call for the command execution to be allowed.

property.name: hive.security.metastore.authorization.auth.reads
property.description: If this is true, metastore authorizer authorizes read actions on database, table

property.name: hive.security.metastore.authenticator.manager
property.description: authenticator manager class name to be used in the metastore for authentication. The user defined authenticator should implement interface org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.security.HiveAuthenticationProvider.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.createtable.user.grants
property.description: the privileges automatically granted to some users whenever a table gets created. An example like "userX,userY:select;userZ:create" will grant select privilege to userX and userY, and grant create privilege to userZ whenever a new table created.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.createtable.group.grants
property.description: the privileges automatically granted to some groups whenever a table gets created. An example like "groupX,groupY:select;groupZ:create" will grant select privilege to groupX and groupY, and grant create privilege to groupZ whenever a new table created.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.createtable.role.grants
property.description: the privileges automatically granted to some roles whenever a table gets created. An example like "roleX,roleY:select;roleZ:create" will grant select privilege to roleX and roleY, and grant create privilege to roleZ whenever a new table created.

property.name: hive.security.authorization.createtable.owner.grants
property.description: The privileges automatically granted to the owner whenever a table gets created. An example like "select,drop" will grant select and drop privilege to the owner of the table. Note that the default gives the creator of a table no access to the table (but see HIVE-8067).

property.name: hive.security.authorization.task.factory
property.description: Authorization DDL task factory implementation

property.name: hive.security.authorization.sqlstd.confwhitelist
property.description: A Java regex. Configurations parameters that match this regex can be modified by user when SQL standard authorization is enabled. To get the default value, use the 'set <param>' command. Note that the hive.conf.restricted.list checks are still enforced after the white list check

property.name: hive.security.authorization.sqlstd.confwhitelist.append
property.description: 2nd Java regex that it would match in addition to hive.security.authorization.sqlstd.confwhitelist. Do not include a starting "|" in the value. Using this regex instead of updating the original regex means that you can append to the default set by SQL standard authorization instead of replacing it entirely.

property.name: hive.cli.print.header
property.description: Whether to print the names of the columns in query output.

property.name: hive.cli.print.escape.crlf
property.description: Whether to print carriage returns and line feeds in row output as escaped \r and \n

property.name: hive.cli.tez.session.async
property.description: Whether to start Tez session in background when running CLI with Tez, allowing CLI to be available earlier.

property.name: hive.disable.unsafe.external.table.operations
property.description: Whether to disable certain optimizations and operations on external tables, on the assumption that data changes by external applications may have negative effects on these operations.

property.name: hive.error.on.empty.partition
property.description: Whether to throw an exception if dynamic partition insert generates empty results.

property.name: hive.exim.uri.scheme.whitelist
property.description: A comma separated list of acceptable URI schemes for import and export.

property.name: hive.exim.strict.repl.tables
property.description: Parameter that determines if 'regular' (non-replication) export dumps can be imported on to tables that are the target of replication. If this parameter is set, regular imports will check if the destination table(if it exists) has a 'repl.last.id' set on it. If so, it will fail.

property.name: hive.repl.task.factory
property.description: Parameter that can be used to override which ReplicationTaskFactory will be used to instantiate ReplicationTask events. Override for third party repl plugins

property.name: hive.rework.mapredwork
property.description: should rework the mapred work or not. This is first introduced by SymlinkTextInputFormat to replace symlink files with real paths at compile time.

property.name: hive.io.exception.handlers
property.description: A list of io exception handler class names. This is used to construct a list exception handlers to handle exceptions thrown by record readers

property.name: hive.log4j.file
property.description: Hive log4j configuration file. If the property is not set, then logging will be initialized using hive-log4j2.properties found on the classpath. If the property is set, the value must be a valid URI (java.net.URI, e.g. "file:///tmp/my-logging.xml"), which you can then extract a URL from and pass to PropertyConfigurator.configure(URL).

property.name: hive.exec.log4j.file
property.description: Hive log4j configuration file for execution mode(sub command). If the property is not set, then logging will be initialized using hive-exec-log4j2.properties found on the classpath. If the property is set, the value must be a valid URI (java.net.URI, e.g. "file:///tmp/my-logging.xml"), which you can then extract a URL from and pass to PropertyConfigurator.configure(URL).

property.name: hive.async.log.enabled
property.description: Whether to enable Log4j2's asynchronous logging. Asynchronous logging can give significant performance improvement as logging will be handled in separate thread that uses LMAX disruptor queue for buffering log messages. Refer https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/manual/async.html for benefits and drawbacks.

property.name: hive.log.explain.output
property.description: Whether to log explain output for every query. When enabled, will log EXPLAIN EXTENDED output for the query at INFO log4j log level and in WebUI / Drilldown / Show Query.

property.name: hive.explain.user
property.description: Whether to show explain result at user level. When enabled, will log EXPLAIN output for the query at user level. Tez only.

property.name: hive.spark.explain.user
property.description: Whether to show explain result at user level. When enabled, will log EXPLAIN output for the query at user level. Spark only.

property.name: hive.autogen.columnalias.prefix.label
property.description: String used as a prefix when auto generating column alias. By default the prefix label will be appended with a column position number to form the column alias. Auto generation would happen if an aggregate function is used in a select clause without an explicit alias.

property.name: hive.autogen.columnalias.prefix.includefuncname
property.description: Whether to include function name in the column alias auto generated by Hive.

property.name: hive.service.metrics.class
property.description: Expects one of [org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.metrics.metrics2.codahalemetrics, org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.metrics.legacymetrics]. Hive metrics subsystem implementation class.

property.name: hive.service.metrics.codahale.reporter.classes
property.description: Comma separated list of reporter implementation classes for metric class org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.metrics.metrics2.CodahaleMetrics. Overrides HIVE_METRICS_REPORTER conf if present

property.name: hive.service.metrics.reporter
property.description: Reporter implementations for metric class org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.metrics.metrics2.CodahaleMetrics;Deprecated, use HIVE_CODAHALE_METRICS_REPORTER_CLASSES instead. This configuraiton will be overridden by HIVE_CODAHALE_METRICS_REPORTER_CLASSES if present. Comma separated list of JMX, CONSOLE, JSON_FILE, HADOOP2

property.name: hive.service.metrics.file.location
property.description: For metric class org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.metrics.metrics2.CodahaleMetrics JSON_FILE reporter, the location of local JSON metrics file. This file will get overwritten at every interval.

property.name: hive.service.metrics.file.frequency
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. For metric class org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.metrics.metrics2.JsonFileMetricsReporter, the frequency of updating JSON metrics file.

property.name: hive.service.metrics.hadoop2.frequency
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. For metric class org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.metrics.metrics2.Metrics2Reporter, the frequency of updating the HADOOP2 metrics system.

property.name: hive.service.metrics.hadoop2.component
property.description: Component name to provide to Hadoop2 Metrics system. Ideally 'hivemetastore' for the MetaStore and and 'hiveserver2' for HiveServer2.

property.name: hive.exec.perf.logger
property.description: The class responsible for logging client side performance metrics. Must be a subclass of org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.log.PerfLogger

property.name: hive.start.cleanup.scratchdir
property.description: To cleanup the Hive scratchdir when starting the Hive Server

property.name: hive.scratchdir.lock
property.description: To hold a lock file in scratchdir to prevent to be removed by cleardanglingscratchdir

property.name: hive.insert.into.multilevel.dirs
property.description: Where to insert into multilevel directories like "insert directory '/HIVEFT25686/chinna/' from table"

property.name: hive.insert.into.external.tables
property.description: whether insert into external tables is allowed

property.name: hive.exec.temporary.table.storage
property.description: Expects one of [memory, ssd, default]. Define the storage policy for temporary tables.Choices between memory, ssd and default

property.name: hive.query.lifetime.hooks
property.description: A comma separated list of hooks which implement QueryLifeTimeHook. These will be triggered before/after query compilation and before/after query execution, in the order specified.Implementations of QueryLifeTimeHookWithParseHooks can also be specified in this list. If they arespecified then they will be invoked in the same places as QueryLifeTimeHooks and will be invoked during pre and post query parsing

property.name: hive.exec.driver.run.hooks
property.description: A comma separated list of hooks which implement HiveDriverRunHook. Will be run at the beginning and end of Driver.run, these will be run in the order specified.

property.name: hive.ddl.output.format
property.description: The data format to use for DDL output. One of "text" (for human readable text) or "json" (for a json object).

property.name: hive.entity.separator
property.description: Separator used to construct names of tables and partitions. For example, dbname@tablename@partitionname

property.name: hive.entity.capture.transform
property.description: Compiler to capture transform URI referred in the query

property.name: hive.display.partition.cols.separately
property.description: In older Hive version (0.10 and earlier) no distinction was made between partition columns or non-partition columns while displaying columns in describe table. From 0.12 onwards, they are displayed separately. This flag will let you get old behavior, if desired. See, test-case in patch for HIVE-6689.

property.name: hive.ssl.protocol.blacklist
property.description: SSL Versions to disable for all Hive Servers

property.name: hive.privilege.synchronizer.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Interval to synchronize privileges from external authorizer periodically in HS2

property.name: hive.server2.clear.dangling.scratchdir
property.description: Clear dangling scratch dir periodically in HS2

property.name: hive.server2.clear.dangling.scratchdir.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Interval to clear dangling scratch dir periodically in HS2

property.name: hive.server2.sleep.interval.between.start.attempts
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. The time should be in between 0 msec (inclusive) and 9223372036854775807 msec (inclusive). Amount of time to sleep between HiveServer2 start attempts. Primarily meant for tests

property.name: hive.server2.max.start.attempts
property.description: Expects value bigger than 0. Number of times HiveServer2 will attempt to start before exiting. The sleep interval between retries is determined by hive.server2.sleep.interval.between.start.attempts The default of 30 will keep trying for 30 minutes.

property.name: hive.server2.support.dynamic.service.discovery
property.description: Whether HiveServer2 supports dynamic service discovery for its clients. To support this, each instance of HiveServer2 currently uses ZooKeeper to register itself, when it is brought up. JDBC/ODBC clients should use the ZooKeeper ensemble: hive.zookeeper.quorum in their connection string.

property.name: hive.server2.zookeeper.namespace
property.description: The parent node in ZooKeeper used by HiveServer2 when supporting dynamic service discovery.

property.name: hive.server2.zookeeper.publish.configs
property.description: Whether we should publish HiveServer2's configs to ZooKeeper.

property.name: hive.server2.global.init.file.location
property.description: Either the location of a HS2 global init file or a directory containing a .hiverc file. If the property is set, the value must be a valid path to an init file or directory where the init file is located.

property.name: hive.server2.transport.mode
property.description: Expects one of [binary, http]. Transport mode of HiveServer2.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.bind.host
property.description: Bind host on which to run the HiveServer2 Thrift service.

property.name: hive.driver.parallel.compilation
property.description: Whether to enable parallel compilation of the queries between sessions and within the same session on HiveServer2. The default is false.

property.name: hive.server2.compile.lock.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Number of seconds a request will wait to acquire the compile lock before giving up. Setting it to 0s disables the timeout.

property.name: hive.server2.parallel.ops.in.session
property.description: Whether to allow several parallel operations (such as SQL statements) in one session.

property.name: hive.server2.materializedviews.registry.impl
property.description: Expects one of [default, dummy]. The implementation that we should use for the materialized views registry. DEFAULT: Default cache for materialized views DUMMY: Do not cache materialized views and hence forward requests to metastore

property.name: hive.server2.webui.host
property.description: The host address the HiveServer2 WebUI will listen on

property.name: hive.server2.webui.port
property.description: The port the HiveServer2 WebUI will listen on. This can beset to 0 or a negative integer to disable the web UI

property.name: hive.server2.webui.max.threads
property.description: The max HiveServer2 WebUI threads

property.name: hive.server2.webui.use.ssl
property.description: Set this to true for using SSL encryption for HiveServer2 WebUI.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.keystore.path
property.description: SSL certificate keystore location for HiveServer2 WebUI.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.keystore.password
property.description: SSL certificate keystore password for HiveServer2 WebUI.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.use.spnego
property.description: If true, the HiveServer2 WebUI will be secured with SPNEGO. Clients must authenticate with Kerberos.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.spnego.keytab
property.description: The path to the Kerberos Keytab file containing the HiveServer2 WebUI SPNEGO service principal.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.spnego.principal
property.description: The HiveServer2 WebUI SPNEGO service principal. The special string _HOST will be replaced automatically with the value of hive.server2.webui.host or the correct host name.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.max.historic.queries
property.description: The maximum number of past queries to show in HiverSever2 WebUI.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.use.pam
property.description: If true, the HiveServer2 WebUI will be secured with PAM.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.enable.cors
property.description: Whether to enable cross origin requests (CORS)

property.name: hive.server2.webui.cors.allowed.origins
property.description: Comma separated list of origins that are allowed when CORS is enabled.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.cors.allowed.methods
property.description: Comma separated list of http methods that are allowed when CORS is enabled.

property.name: hive.server2.webui.cors.allowed.headers
property.description: Comma separated list of http headers that are allowed when CORS is enabled.

property.name: hive.server2.active.passive.ha.enable
property.description: Whether HiveServer2 Active/Passive High Availability be enabled when Hive Interactive sessions are enabled.This will also require hive.server2.support.dynamic.service.discovery to be enabled.

property.name: hive.server2.active.passive.ha.registry.namespace
property.description: When HiveServer2 Active/Passive High Availability is enabled, uses this namespace for registering HS2 instances with zookeeper

property.name: hive.server2.tez.interactive.queue
property.description: A single YARN queues to use for Hive Interactive sessions. When this is specified, workload management is enabled and used for these sessions.

property.name: hive.server2.wm.worker.threads
property.description: Number of worker threads to use to perform the synchronous operations with Tez sessions for workload management (e.g. opening, closing, etc.)

property.name: hive.server2.wm.allow.any.pool.via.jdbc
property.description: Applies when a user specifies a target WM pool in the JDBC connection string. If false, the user can only specify a pool he is mapped to (e.g. make a choice among multiple group mappings); if true, the user can specify any existing pool.

property.name: hive.server2.wm.pool.metrics
property.description: Whether per-pool WM metrics should be enabled.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.wm.am.registry.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. The timeout for AM registry registration, after which (on attempting to use the session), we kill it and try to get another one.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.default.queues
property.description: A list of comma separated values corresponding to YARN queues of the same name. When HiveServer2 is launched in Tez mode, this configuration needs to be set for multiple Tez sessions to run in parallel on the cluster.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.sessions.per.default.queue
property.description: A positive integer that determines the number of Tez sessions that should be launched on each of the queues specified by "hive.server2.tez.default.queues". Determines the parallelism on each queue.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.initialize.default.sessions
property.description: This flag is used in HiveServer2 to enable a user to use HiveServer2 without turning on Tez for HiveServer2. The user could potentially want to run queries over Tez without the pool of sessions.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.queue.access.check
property.description: Whether to check user access to explicitly specified YARN queues. yarn.resourcemanager.webapp.address must be configured to use this.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.session.lifetime
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is hour if not specified. The lifetime of the Tez sessions launched by HS2 when default sessions are enabled. Set to 0 to disable session expiration.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.session.lifetime.jitter
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is hour if not specified. The jitter for Tez session lifetime; prevents all the sessions from restarting at once.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.sessions.init.threads
property.description: If hive.server2.tez.initialize.default.sessions is enabled, the maximum number of threads to use to initialize the default sessions.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.sessions.restricted.configs
property.description: The configuration settings that cannot be set when submitting jobs to HiveServer2. If any of these are set to values different from those in the server configuration, an exception will be thrown.

property.name: hive.server2.tez.sessions.custom.queue.allowed
property.description: Expects one of [true, false, ignore]. Whether Tez session pool should allow submitting queries to custom queues. The options are true, false (error out), ignore (accept the query but ignore the queue setting).

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.enabled
property.description: When true, HS2 will save operation logs and make them available for clients

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.log.location
property.description: Top level directory where operation logs are stored if logging functionality is enabled

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.level
property.description: Expects one of [none, execution, performance, verbose]. HS2 operation logging mode available to clients to be set at session level. For this to work, hive.server2.logging.operation.enabled should be set to true. NONE: Ignore any logging EXECUTION: Log completion of tasks PERFORMANCE: Execution + Performance logs VERBOSE: All logs

property.name: hive.server2.operation.log.cleanup.delay
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. When a query is cancelled (via kill query, query timeout or triggers), operation logs gets cleaned up after this delay

property.name: hive.server2.limit.connections.per.user
property.description: Maximum hive server2 connections per user. Any user exceeding this limit will not be allowed to connect. Default=0 does not enforce limits.

property.name: hive.server2.limit.connections.per.ipaddress
property.description: Maximum hive server2 connections per ipaddress. Any ipaddress exceeding this limit will not be allowed to connect. Default=0 does not enforce limits.

property.name: hive.server2.limit.connections.per.user.ipaddress
property.description: Maximum hive server2 connections per user:ipaddress combination. Any user-ipaddress exceeding this limit will not be allowed to connect. Default=0 does not enforce limits.

property.name: hive.server2.metrics.enabled
property.description: Enable metrics on the HiveServer2.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.port
property.description: Port number of HiveServer2 Thrift interface when hive.server2.transport.mode is 'http'.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.path
property.description: Path component of URL endpoint when in HTTP mode.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.max.message.size
property.description: Maximum message size in bytes a HS2 server will accept.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.max.idle.time
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Maximum idle time for a connection on the server when in HTTP mode.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.worker.keepalive.time
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Keepalive time for an idle http worker thread. When the number of workers exceeds min workers, excessive threads are killed after this time interval.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.request.header.size
property.description: Request header size in bytes, when using HTTP transport mode. Jetty defaults used.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.response.header.size
property.description: Response header size in bytes, when using HTTP transport mode. Jetty defaults used.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.compression.enabled
property.description: Enable thrift http compression via Jetty compression support

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.cookie.auth.enabled
property.description: When true, HiveServer2 in HTTP transport mode, will use cookie based authentication mechanism.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.cookie.max.age
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Maximum age in seconds for server side cookie used by HS2 in HTTP mode.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.cookie.domain
property.description: Domain for the HS2 generated cookies

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.cookie.path
property.description: Path for the HS2 generated cookies

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.cookie.is.secure
property.description: Deprecated: Secure attribute of the HS2 generated cookie (this is automatically enabled for SSL enabled HiveServer2).

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.http.cookie.is.httponly
property.description: HttpOnly attribute of the HS2 generated cookie.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.port
property.description: Port number of HiveServer2 Thrift interface when hive.server2.transport.mode is 'binary'.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.sasl.qop
property.description: Expects one of [auth, auth-int, auth-conf]. Sasl QOP value; set it to one of following values to enable higher levels of protection for HiveServer2 communication with clients. Setting hadoop.rpc.protection to a higher level than HiveServer2 does not make sense in most situations. HiveServer2 ignores hadoop.rpc.protection in favor of hive.server2.thrift.sasl.qop. "auth" - authentication only (default) "auth-int" - authentication plus integrity protection "auth-conf" - authentication plus integrity and confidentiality protection This is applicable only if HiveServer2 is configured to use Kerberos authentication.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.min.worker.threads
property.description: Minimum number of Thrift worker threads

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.max.worker.threads
property.description: Maximum number of Thrift worker threads

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.exponential.backoff.slot.length
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Binary exponential backoff slot time for Thrift clients during login to HiveServer2, for retries until hitting Thrift client timeout

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.login.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Timeout for Thrift clients during login to HiveServer2

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.worker.keepalive.time
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Keepalive time (in seconds) for an idle worker thread. When the number of workers exceeds min workers, excessive threads are killed after this time interval.

property.name: hive.server2.async.exec.threads
property.description: Number of threads in the async thread pool for HiveServer2

property.name: hive.server2.async.exec.shutdown.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. How long HiveServer2 shutdown will wait for async threads to terminate.

property.name: hive.server2.async.exec.wait.queue.size
property.description: Size of the wait queue for async thread pool in HiveServer2. After hitting this limit, the async thread pool will reject new requests.

property.name: hive.server2.async.exec.keepalive.time
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Time that an idle HiveServer2 async thread (from the thread pool) will wait for a new task to arrive before terminating

property.name: hive.server2.async.exec.async.compile
property.description: Whether to enable compiling async query asynchronously. If enabled, it is unknown if the query will have any resultset before compilation completed.

property.name: hive.server2.long.polling.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Time that HiveServer2 will wait before responding to asynchronous calls that use long polling

property.name: hive.session.impl.classname
property.description: Classname for custom implementation of hive session

property.name: hive.session.impl.withugi.classname
property.description: Classname for custom implementation of hive session with UGI

property.name: hive.server2.authentication
property.description: Expects one of [nosasl, none, ldap, kerberos, pam, custom]. Client authentication types. NONE: no authentication check LDAP: LDAP/AD based authentication KERBEROS: Kerberos/GSSAPI authentication CUSTOM: Custom authentication provider (Use with property hive.server2.custom.authentication.class) PAM: Pluggable authentication module NOSASL: Raw transport

property.name: hive.server2.allow.user.substitution
property.description: Allow alternate user to be specified as part of HiveServer2 open connection request.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.kerberos.keytab
property.description: Kerberos keytab file for server principal

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos server principal

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.client.kerberos.principal
property.description: Kerberos principal used by the HA hive_server2s.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.spnego.keytab
property.description: keytab file for SPNego principal, optional, typical value would look like /etc/security/keytabs/spnego.service.keytab, This keytab would be used by HiveServer2 when Kerberos security is enabled and HTTP transport mode is used. This needs to be set only if SPNEGO is to be used in authentication. SPNego authentication would be honored only if valid hive.server2.authentication.spnego.principal and hive.server2.authentication.spnego.keytab are specified.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.spnego.principal
property.description: SPNego service principal, optional, typical value would look like HTTP/_HOST@EXAMPLE.COM SPNego service principal would be used by HiveServer2 when Kerberos security is enabled and HTTP transport mode is used. This needs to be set only if SPNEGO is to be used in authentication.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.url
property.description: LDAP connection URL(s), this value could contain URLs to multiple LDAP servers instances for HA, each LDAP URL is separated by a SPACE character. URLs are used in the order specified until a connection is successful.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.baseDN
property.description: LDAP base DN

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.groupDNPattern
property.description: COLON-separated list of patterns to use to find DNs for group entities in this directory. Use %s where the actual group name is to be substituted for. For example: CN=%s,CN=Groups,DC=subdomain,DC=domain,DC=com.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.groupFilter
property.description: COMMA-separated list of LDAP Group names (short name not full DNs). For example: HiveAdmins,HadoopAdmins,Administrators

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.userDNPattern
property.description: COLON-separated list of patterns to use to find DNs for users in this directory. Use %s where the actual group name is to be substituted for. For example: CN=%s,CN=Users,DC=subdomain,DC=domain,DC=com.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.userFilter
property.description: COMMA-separated list of LDAP usernames (just short names, not full DNs). For example: hiveuser,impalauser,hiveadmin,hadoopadmin

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.guidKey
property.description: LDAP attribute name whose values are unique in this LDAP server. For example: uid or CN.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.groupMembershipKey
property.description: LDAP attribute name on the group object that contains the list of distinguished names for the user, group, and contact objects that are members of the group. For example: member, uniqueMember or memberUid

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.userMembershipKey
property.description: LDAP attribute name on the user object that contains groups of which the user is a direct member, except for the primary group, which is represented by the primaryGroupId. For example: memberOf

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.groupClassKey
property.description: LDAP attribute name on the group entry that is to be used in LDAP group searches. For example: group, groupOfNames or groupOfUniqueNames.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.customLDAPQuery
property.description: A full LDAP query that LDAP Atn provider uses to execute against LDAP Server. If this query returns a null resultset, the LDAP Provider fails the Authentication request, succeeds if the user is part of the resultset.For example: (&(objectClass=group)(objectClass=top)(instanceType=4)(cn=Domain*)) (&(objectClass=person)(|(sAMAccountName=admin)(|(memberOf=CN=Domain Admins,CN=Users,DC=domain,DC=com)(memberOf=CN=Administrators,CN=Builtin,DC=domain,DC=com))))

property.name: hive.server2.custom.authentication.class
property.description: Custom authentication class. Used when property 'hive.server2.authentication' is set to 'CUSTOM'. Provided class must be a proper implementation of the interface org.apache.hive.service.auth.PasswdAuthenticationProvider. HiveServer2 will call its Authenticate(user, passed) method to authenticate requests. The implementation may optionally implement Hadoop's org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable class to grab Hive's Configuration object.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.pam.services
property.description: List of the underlying pam services that should be used when auth type is PAM A file with the same name must exist in /etc/pam.d

property.name: hive.distcp.privileged.doAs
property.description: This property allows privileged distcp executions done by hive to run as this user.

property.name: hive.server2.table.type.mapping
property.description: Expects one of [classic, hive]. This setting reflects how HiveServer2 will report the table types for JDBC and other client implementations that retrieve the available tables and supported table types HIVE : Exposes Hive's native table types like MANAGED_TABLE, EXTERNAL_TABLE, VIRTUAL_VIEW CLASSIC : More generic types like TABLE and VIEW

property.name: hive.server2.use.SSL
property.description: Set this to true for using SSL encryption in HiveServer2.

property.name: hive.server2.keystore.path
property.description: SSL certificate keystore location.

property.name: hive.server2.keystore.password
property.description: SSL certificate keystore password.

property.name: hive.server2.map.fair.scheduler.queue
property.description: If the YARN fair scheduler is configured and HiveServer2 is running in non-impersonation mode, this setting determines the user for fair scheduler queue mapping. If set to true (default), the logged-in user determines the fair scheduler queue for submitted jobs, so that map reduce resource usage can be tracked by user. If set to false, all Hive jobs go to the 'hive' user's queue.

property.name: hive.server2.builtin.udf.whitelist
property.description: Comma separated list of builtin udf names allowed in queries. An empty whitelist allows all builtin udfs to be executed. The udf black list takes precedence over udf white list

property.name: hive.server2.builtin.udf.blacklist
property.description: Comma separated list of udfs names. These udfs will not be allowed in queries. The udf black list takes precedence over udf white list

property.name: hive.allow.udf.load.on.demand
property.description: Whether enable loading UDFs from metastore on demand; this is mostly relevant for HS2 and was the default behavior before Hive 1.2. Off by default.

property.name: hive.server2.session.check.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. The time should be bigger than or equal to 3000 msec. The check interval for session/operation timeout, which can be disabled by setting to zero or negative value.

property.name: hive.server2.close.session.on.disconnect
property.description: Session will be closed when connection is closed. Set this to false to have session outlive its parent connection.

property.name: hive.server2.idle.session.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Session will be closed when it's not accessed for this duration, which can be disabled by setting to zero or negative value.

property.name: hive.server2.idle.operation.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Operation will be closed when it's not accessed for this duration of time, which can be disabled by setting to zero value. With positive value, it's checked for operations in terminal state only (FINISHED, CANCELED, CLOSED, ERROR). With negative value, it's checked for all of the operations regardless of state.

property.name: hive.server2.idle.session.check.operation
property.description: Session will be considered to be idle only if there is no activity, and there is no pending operation. This setting takes effect only if session idle timeout (hive.server2.idle.session.timeout) and checking (hive.server2.session.check.interval) are enabled.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.client.retry.limit
property.description: Number of retries upon failure of Thrift HiveServer2 calls

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.client.connect.retry.limit
property.description: Number of retries while opening a connection to HiveServe2

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.client.retry.delay.seconds
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Number of seconds for the HiveServer2 thrift client to wait between consecutive connection attempts. Also specifies the time to wait between retrying thrift calls upon failures

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.client.user
property.description: Username to use against thrift client

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.client.password
property.description: Password to use against thrift client

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.resultset.serialize.in.tasks
property.description: Whether we should serialize the Thrift structures used in JDBC ResultSet RPC in task nodes. We use SequenceFile and ThriftJDBCBinarySerDe to read and write the final results if this is true.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.resultset.max.fetch.size
property.description: Max number of rows sent in one Fetch RPC call by the server to the client.

property.name: hive.server2.thrift.resultset.default.fetch.size
property.description: The number of rows sent in one Fetch RPC call by the server to the client, if not specified by the client.

property.name: hive.server2.xsrf.filter.enabled
property.description: If enabled, HiveServer2 will block any requests made to it over http if an X-XSRF-HEADER header is not present

property.name: hive.security.command.whitelist
property.description: Comma separated list of non-SQL Hive commands users are authorized to execute

property.name: hive.server2.job.credential.provider.path
property.description: If set, this configuration property should provide a comma-separated list of URLs that indicates the type and location of providers to be used by hadoop credential provider API. It provides HiveServer2 the ability to provide job-specific credential providers for jobs run using MR and Spark execution engines. This functionality has not been tested against Tez.

property.name: hive.mv.files.thread
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). The size should be in between 0Pb (inclusive) and 1Kb (inclusive). Number of threads used to move files in move task. Set it to 0 to disable multi-threaded file moves. This parameter is also used by MSCK to check tables.

property.name: hive.load.dynamic.partitions.thread
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). The size should be in between 1 bytes (inclusive) and 1Kb (inclusive). Number of threads used to load dynamic partitions.

property.name: hive.multi.insert.move.tasks.share.dependencies
property.description: If this is set all move tasks for tables/partitions (not directories) at the end of a multi-insert query will only begin once the dependencies for all these move tasks have been met. Advantages: If concurrency is enabled, the locks will only be released once the query has finished, so with this config enabled, the time when the table/partition is generated will be much closer to when the lock on it is released. Disadvantages: If concurrency is not enabled, with this disabled, the tables/partitions which are produced by this query and finish earlier will be available for querying much earlier. Since the locks are only released once the query finishes, this does not apply if concurrency is enabled.
