property.name: hive.exec.infer.bucket.sort
property.description: If this is set, when writing partitions, the metadata will include the bucketing/sorting properties with which the data was written if any (this will not overwrite the metadata inherited from the table if the table is bucketed/sorted)

property.name: hive.exec.infer.bucket.sort.num.buckets.power.two
property.description: If this is set, when setting the number of reducers for the map reduce task which writes the final output files, it will choose a number which is a power of two, unless the user specifies the number of reducers to use using mapred.reduce.tasks. The number of reducers may be set to a power of two, only to be followed by a merge task meaning preventing anything from being inferred. With hive.exec.infer.bucket.sort set to true: Advantages: If this is not set, the number of buckets for partitions will seem arbitrary, which means that the number of mappers used for optimized joins, for example, will be very low. With this set, since the number of buckets used for any partition is a power of two, the number of mappers used for optimized joins will be the least number of buckets used by any partition being joined. Disadvantages: This may mean a much larger or much smaller number of reducers being used in the final map reduce job, e.g. if a job was originally going to take 257 reducers, it will now take 512 reducers, similarly if the max number of reducers is 511, and a job was going to use this many, it will now use 256 reducers.

property.name: hive.optimize.listbucketing
property.description: Enable list bucketing optimizer. Default value is false so that we disable it by default.

property.name: hive.server.read.socket.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Timeout for the HiveServer to close the connection if no response from the client. By default, 10 seconds.

property.name: hive.server.tcp.keepalive
property.description: Whether to enable TCP keepalive for the Hive Server. Keepalive will prevent accumulation of half-open connections.

property.name: hive.decode.partition.name
property.description: Whether to show the unquoted partition names in query results.

property.name: hive.execution.mode
property.description: Expects one of [container, llap]. Chooses whether query fragments will run in container or in llap

property.name: hive.jar.directory
property.description: This is the location hive in tez mode will look for to find a site wide installed hive instance.

property.name: hive.user.install.directory
property.description: If hive (in tez mode only) cannot find a usable hive jar in "hive.jar.directory", it will upload the hive jar to "hive.user.install.directory/user.name" and use it to run queries.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorized mode of query execution. The default value is true to reflect that our most expected Hive deployment will be using vectorization.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.reduce.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorized mode of the reduce-side of query execution. The default value is true.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.reduce.groupby.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorized mode of the reduce-side GROUP BY query execution. The default value is true.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.native.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable native (i.e. non-pass through) vectorization of queries using MapJoin. The default value is true.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.native.multikey.only.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to restrict use of native vector map join hash tables to the MultiKey in queries using MapJoin. The default value is false.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.minmax.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vector map join hash tables to use max / max filtering for integer join queries using MapJoin. The default value is false.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.overflow.repeated.threshold
property.description: The number of small table rows for a match in vector map join hash tables where we use the repeated field optimization in overflow vectorized row batch for join queries using MapJoin. A value of -1 means do use the join result optimization. Otherwise, threshold value can be 0 to maximum integer.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.mapjoin.native.fast.hashtable.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable use of native fast vector map join hash tables in queries using MapJoin. The default value is false.

property.name: hive.vectorized.groupby.checkinterval
property.description: Number of entries added to the group by aggregation hash before a recomputation of average entry size is performed.

property.name: hive.vectorized.groupby.maxentries
property.description: Max number of entries in the vector group by aggregation hashtables. Exceeding this will trigger a flush irrelevant of memory pressure condition.

property.name: hive.vectorized.groupby.flush.percent
property.description: Percent of entries in the group by aggregation hash flushed when the memory threshold is exceeded.

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.reducesink.new.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable the new vectorization of queries using ReduceSink. iThe default value is true.

property.name: hive.vectorized.use.vectorized.input.format
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorizing with vectorized input file format capable SerDe. The default value is true.

property.name: hive.vectorized.input.format.excludes
property.description: This configuration should be set to fully described input format class names for which vectorized input format should not be used for vectorized execution.

property.name: hive.vectorized.use.vector.serde.deserialize
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorizing rows using vector deserialize. The default value is true.

property.name: hive.vectorized.use.row.serde.deserialize
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorizing using row deserialize. The default value is false.

property.name: hive.vectorized.row.serde.inputformat.excludes
property.description: The input formats not supported by row deserialize vectorization.

property.name: hive.vectorized.adaptor.usage.mode
property.description: Expects one of [none, chosen, all]. Specifies the extent to which the VectorUDFAdaptor will be used for UDFs that do not have a corresponding vectorized class. 0. none : disable any usage of VectorUDFAdaptor 1. chosen : use VectorUDFAdaptor for a small set of UDFs that were chosen for good performance 2. all : use VectorUDFAdaptor for all UDFs

property.name: hive.vectorized.execution.ptf.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorized mode of the PTF of query execution. The default value is true.

property.name: hive.vectorized.ptf.max.memory.buffering.batch.count
property.description: Maximum number of vectorized row batches to buffer in memory for PTF The default value is 25

property.name: hive.vectorized.complex.types.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorization of expressions with complex types. The default value is true.

property.name: hive.vectorized.groupby.complex.types.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable group by vectorization of aggregations that use complex types.

property.name: hive.vectorized.row.identifier.enabled
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable vectorization of ROW__ID.

property.name: hive.vectorized.use.checked.expressions
property.description: This flag should be set to true to use overflow checked vector expressions when available. For example, arithmetic expressions which can overflow the output data type can be evaluated using checked vector expressions so that they produce same result as non-vectorized evaluation.

property.name: hive.vectorized.adaptor.suppress.evaluate.exceptions
property.description: This flag should be set to true to suppress HiveException from the generic UDF function evaluate call and turn them into NULLs. Assume, by default, this is not needed

property.name: hive.vectorized.input.format.supports.enabled
property.description: Which vectorized input format support features are enabled for vectorization. That is, if a VectorizedInputFormat input format does support "decimal_64" for example this variable must enable that to be used in vectorization

property.name: hive.vectorized.if.expr.mode
property.description: Expects one of [adaptor, good, better]. Specifies the extent to which SQL IF statements will be vectorized. 0. adaptor: only use the VectorUDFAdaptor to vectorize IF statements 1. good : use regular vectorized IF expression classes that get good performance 2. better : use vectorized IF expression classes that conditionally execute THEN/ELSE expressions for better performance.

property.name: hive.typecheck.on.insert
property.description: This property has been extended to control whether to check, convert, and normalize partition value to conform to its column type in partition operations including but not limited to insert, such as alter, describe etc.

property.name: hive.hadoop.classpath
property.description: For Windows OS, we need to pass HIVE_HADOOP_CLASSPATH Java parameter while starting HiveServer2 using "-hiveconf hive.hadoop.classpath=%HIVE_LIB%".

property.name: hive.rpc.query.plan
property.description: Whether to send the query plan via local resource or RPC

property.name: hive.compute.splits.in.am
property.description: Whether to generate the splits locally or in the AM (tez only)

property.name: hive.tez.input.generate.consistent.splits
property.description: Whether to generate consistent split locations when generating splits in the AM

property.name: hive.prewarm.enabled
property.description: Enables container prewarm for Tez/Spark (Hadoop 2 only)

property.name: hive.prewarm.numcontainers
property.description: Controls the number of containers to prewarm for Tez/Spark (Hadoop 2 only)

property.name: hive.prewarm.spark.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Time to wait to finish prewarming spark executors

property.name: hive.stageid.rearrange
property.description: Expects one of [none, idonly, traverse, execution].

property.name: hive.counters.group.name
property.description: The name of counter group for internal Hive variables (CREATED_FILE, FATAL_ERROR, etc.)

property.name: hive.support.quoted.identifiers
property.description: Expects one of [none, column]. Whether to use quoted identifier. 'none' or 'column' can be used. none: default(past) behavior. Implies only alphaNumeric and underscore are valid characters in identifiers. column: implies column names can contain any character.

property.name: hive.support.special.characters.tablename
property.description: This flag should be set to true to enable support for special characters in table names. When it is set to false, only [a-zA-Z_0-9]+ are supported. The only supported special character right now is '/'. This flag applies only to quoted table names. The default value is true.

property.name: hive.create.as.insert.only
property.description: Whether the eligible tables should be created as ACID insert-only by default. Does not apply to external tables, the ones using storage handlers, etc.

property.name: hive.users.in.admin.role
property.description: Comma separated list of users who are in admin role for bootstrapping. More users can be added in ADMIN role later.

property.name: hive.compat
property.description: Enable (configurable) deprecated behaviors by setting desired level of backward compatibility. Setting to 0.12: Maintains division behavior: int / int = double

property.name: hive.convert.join.bucket.mapjoin.tez
property.description: Whether joins can be automatically converted to bucket map joins in hive when tez is used as the execution engine.

property.name: hive.tez.bmj.use.subcache
property.description: Use subcache to reuse hashtable across multiple tasks

property.name: hive.exec.check.crossproducts
property.description: Check if a plan contains a Cross Product. If there is one, output a warning to the Session's console.

property.name: hive.localize.resource.wait.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Time to wait for another thread to localize the same resource for hive-tez.

property.name: hive.localize.resource.num.wait.attempts
property.description: The number of attempts waiting for localizing a resource in hive-tez.

property.name: hive.tez.auto.reducer.parallelism
property.description: Turn on Tez' auto reducer parallelism feature. When enabled, Hive will still estimate data sizes and set parallelism estimates. Tez will sample source vertices' output sizes and adjust the estimates at runtime as necessary.

property.name: hive.tez.llap.min.reducer.per.executor
property.description: If above 0, the min number of reducers for auto-parallelism for LLAP scheduling will be set to this fraction of the number of executors.

property.name: hive.tez.max.partition.factor
property.description: When auto reducer parallelism is enabled this factor will be used to over-partition data in shuffle edges.

property.name: hive.tez.min.partition.factor
property.description: When auto reducer parallelism is enabled this factor will be used to put a lower limit to the number of reducers that tez specifies.

property.name: hive.tez.bucket.pruning
property.description: When pruning is enabled, filters on bucket columns will be processed by filtering the splits against a bitset of included buckets. This needs predicates produced by hive.optimize.ppd and hive.optimize.index.filters.

property.name: hive.tez.bucket.pruning.compat
property.description: When pruning is enabled, handle possibly broken inserts due to negative hashcodes. This occasionally doubles the data scan cost, but is default enabled for safety

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.partition.pruning
property.description: When dynamic pruning is enabled, joins on partition keys will be processed by sending events from the processing vertices to the Tez application master. These events will be used to prune unnecessary partitions.

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.partition.pruning.max.event.size
property.description: Maximum size of events sent by processors in dynamic pruning. If this size is crossed no pruning will take place.

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.partition.pruning.max.data.size
property.description: Maximum total data size of events in dynamic pruning.

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.semijoin.reduction
property.description: When dynamic semijoin is enabled, shuffle joins will perform a leaky semijoin before shuffle. This requires hive.tez.dynamic.partition.pruning to be enabled.

property.name: hive.tez.min.bloom.filter.entries
property.description: Bloom filter should be of at min certain size to be effective

property.name: hive.tez.max.bloom.filter.entries
property.description: Bloom filter should be of at max certain size to be effective

property.name: hive.tez.bloom.filter.factor
property.description: Bloom filter should be a multiple of this factor with nDV

property.name: hive.tez.bigtable.minsize.semijoin.reduction
property.description: Big table for runtime filteting should be of atleast this size

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.semijoin.reduction.threshold
property.description: Only perform semijoin optimization if the estimated benefit at or above this fraction of the target table

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.semijoin.reduction.for.mapjoin
property.description: Use a semi-join branch for map-joins. This may not make it faster, but is helpful in certain join patterns.

property.name: hive.tez.dynamic.semijoin.reduction.for.dpp.factor
property.description: The factor to decide if semijoin branch feeds into a TableScan which has an outgoing Dynamic Partition Pruning (DPP) branch based on number of distinct values.

property.name: hive.tez.smb.number.waves
property.description: The number of waves in which to run the SMB join. Account for cluster being occupied. Ideally should be 1 wave.

property.name: hive.tez.exec.print.summary
property.description: Display breakdown of execution steps, for every query executed by the shell.

property.name: hive.tez.session.events.print.summary
property.description: Expects one of [none, text, json]. Display summary of all tez sessions related events in text or json format

property.name: hive.tez.exec.inplace.progress
property.description: Updates tez job execution progress in-place in the terminal when hive-cli is used.

property.name: hive.server2.in.place.progress
property.description: Allows hive server 2 to send progress bar update information. This is currently available only if the execution engine is tez.

property.name: hive.tez.dag.status.check.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Interval between subsequent DAG status invocation.

property.name: hive.spark.exec.inplace.progress
property.description: Updates spark job execution progress in-place in the terminal.

property.name: hive.tez.container.max.java.heap.fraction
property.description: This is to override the tez setting with the same name

property.name: hive.tez.task.scale.memory.reserve-fraction.min
property.description: This is to override the tez setting tez.task.scale.memory.reserve-fraction

property.name: hive.tez.task.scale.memory.reserve.fraction.max
property.description: The maximum fraction of JVM memory which Tez will reserve for the processor

property.name: hive.tez.task.scale.memory.reserve.fraction
property.description: The customized fraction of JVM memory which Tez will reserve for the processor

property.name: hive.tez.cartesian-product.enabled
property.description: Use Tez cartesian product edge to speed up cross product

property.name: hive.llap.io.enabled
property.description: Whether the LLAP IO layer is enabled.

property.name: hive.llap.io.row.wrapper.enabled
property.description: Whether the LLAP IO row wrapper is enabled for non-vectorized queries.

property.name: hive.llap.io.acid
property.description: Whether the LLAP IO layer is enabled for ACID.

property.name: hive.llap.io.trace.size
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). The size should be in between 0Pb (inclusive) and 2147483647 bytes (exclusive). The buffer size for a per-fragment LLAP debug trace. 0 to disable.

property.name: hive.llap.io.trace.always.dump
property.description: Whether to always dump the LLAP IO trace (if enabled); the default is on error.

property.name: hive.llap.io.nonvector.wrapper.enabled
property.description: Whether the LLAP IO layer is enabled for non-vectorized queries that read inputs that can be vectorized

property.name: hive.llap.io.memory.mode
property.description: Expects one of [cache, none]. LLAP IO memory usage; 'cache' (the default) uses data and metadata cache with a custom off-heap allocator, 'none' doesn't use either (this mode may result in significant performance degradation)

property.name: hive.llap.io.allocator.alloc.min
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). Minimum allocation possible from LLAP buddy allocator. Allocations below that are padded to minimum allocation. For ORC, should generally be the same as the expected compression buffer size, or next lowest power of 2. Must be a power of 2.

property.name: hive.llap.io.allocator.alloc.max
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). Maximum allocation possible from LLAP buddy allocator. For ORC, should be as large as the largest expected ORC compression buffer size. Must be a power of 2.

property.name: hive.llap.io.allocator.arena.count
property.description: Arena count for LLAP low-level cache; cache will be allocated in the steps of (size/arena_count) bytes. This size must be <= 1Gb and >= max allocation; if it is not the case, an adjusted size will be used. Using powers of 2 is recommended.

property.name: hive.llap.io.memory.size
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). Maximum size for IO allocator or ORC low-level cache.

property.name: hive.llap.io.allocator.direct
property.description: Whether ORC low-level cache should use direct allocation.

property.name: hive.llap.io.allocator.mmap
property.description: Whether ORC low-level cache should use memory mapped allocation (direct I/O). This is recommended to be used along-side NVDIMM (DAX) or NVMe flash storage.

property.name: hive.llap.io.allocator.mmap.path
property.description: Expects a writable directory on the local filesystem. The directory location for mapping NVDIMM/NVMe flash storage into the ORC low-level cache.

property.name: hive.llap.io.allocator.discard.method
property.description: Expects one of [freelist, brute, both]. Which method to use to force-evict blocks to deal with fragmentation: freelist - use half-size free list (discards less, but also less reliable); brute - brute force, discard whatever we can; both - first try free list, then brute force.

property.name: hive.llap.io.allocator.defrag.headroom
property.description: How much of a headroom to leave to allow allocator more flexibility to defragment. The allocator would further cap it to a fraction of total memory.

property.name: hive.llap.io.track.cache.usage
property.description: Whether to tag LLAP cache contents, mapping them to Hive entities (paths for partitions and tables) for reporting.

property.name: hive.llap.io.use.lrfu
property.description: Whether ORC low-level cache should use LRFU cache policy instead of default (FIFO).

property.name: hive.llap.io.lrfu.lambda
property.description: Lambda for ORC low-level cache LRFU cache policy. Must be in [0, 1]. 0 makes LRFU behave like LFU, 1 makes it behave like LRU, values in between balance accordingly. The meaning of this parameter is the inverse of the number of time ticks (cache operations, currently) that cause the combined recency-frequency of a block in cache to be halved.

property.name: hive.llap.cache.allow.synthetic.fileid
property.description: Whether LLAP cache should use synthetic file ID if real one is not available. Systems like HDFS, Isilon, etc. provide a unique file/inode ID. On other FSes (e.g. local FS), the cache would not work by default because LLAP is unable to uniquely track the files; enabling this setting allows LLAP to generate file ID from the path, size and modification time, which is almost certain to identify file uniquely. However, if you use a FS without file IDs and rewrite files a lot (or are paranoid), you might want to avoid this setting.

property.name: hive.llap.cache.defaultfs.only.native.fileid
property.description: Whether LLAP cache should use native file IDs from the default FS only. This is to avoid file ID collisions when several different DFS instances are in use at the same time. Disable this check to allow native file IDs from non-default DFS.

property.name: hive.llap.orc.gap.cache
property.description: Whether LLAP cache for ORC should remember gaps in ORC compression buffer read estimates, to avoid re-reading the data that was read once and discarded because it is unneeded. This is only necessary for ORC files written before HIVE-9660.

property.name: hive.llap.io.use.fileid.path
property.description: Whether LLAP should use fileId (inode)-based path to ensure better consistency for the cases of file overwrites. This is supported on HDFS.

property.name: hive.llap.io.encode.enabled
property.description: Whether LLAP should try to re-encode and cache data for non-ORC formats. This is used on LLAP Server side to determine if the infrastructure for that is initialized.

property.name: hive.llap.io.encode.formats
property.description: The table input formats for which LLAP IO should re-encode and cache data. Comma-separated list.

property.name: hive.llap.io.encode.alloc.size
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). Allocation size for the buffers used to cache encoded data from non-ORC files. Must be a power of two between hive.llap.io.allocator.alloc.min and hive.llap.io.allocator.alloc.max.

property.name: hive.llap.io.encode.vector.serde.enabled
property.description: Whether LLAP should use vectorized SerDe reader to read text data when re-encoding.

property.name: hive.llap.io.encode.vector.serde.async.enabled
property.description: Whether LLAP should use async mode in vectorized SerDe reader to read text data.

property.name: hive.llap.io.encode.slice.row.count
property.description: Row count to use to separate cache slices when reading encoded data from row-based inputs into LLAP cache, if this feature is enabled.

property.name: hive.llap.io.encode.slice.lrr
property.description: Whether to separate cache slices when reading encoded data from text inputs via MR MR LineRecordRedader into LLAP cache, if this feature is enabled. Safety flag.

property.name: hive.llap.io.orc.time.counters
property.description: Whether to enable time counters for LLAP IO layer (time spent in HDFS, etc.)

property.name: hive.llap.io.vrb.queue.limit.base
property.description: The default queue size for VRBs produced by a LLAP IO thread when the processing is slower than the IO. The actual queue size is set per fragment, and is adjusted down from the base, depending on the schema.

property.name: hive.llap.io.vrb.queue.limit.min
property.description: The minimum queue size for VRBs produced by a LLAP IO thread when the processing is slower than the IO (used when determining the size from base size).

property.name: hive.llap.io.share.object.pools
property.description: Whether to used shared object pools in LLAP IO. A safety flag.

property.name: hive.llap.auto.allow.uber
property.description: Whether or not to allow the planner to run vertices in the AM.

property.name: hive.llap.auto.enforce.tree
property.description: Enforce that all parents are in llap, before considering vertex

property.name: hive.llap.auto.enforce.vectorized
property.description: Enforce that inputs are vectorized, before considering vertex

property.name: hive.llap.auto.enforce.stats
property.description: Enforce that col stats are available, before considering vertex

property.name: hive.llap.auto.max.input.size
property.description: Check input size, before considering vertex (-1 disables check)

property.name: hive.llap.auto.max.output.size
property.description: Check output size, before considering vertex (-1 disables check)

property.name: hive.llap.skip.compile.udf.check
property.description: Whether to skip the compile-time check for non-built-in UDFs when deciding whether to execute tasks in LLAP. Skipping the check allows executing UDFs from pre-localized jars in LLAP; if the jars are not pre-localized, the UDFs will simply fail to load.

property.name: hive.llap.allow.permanent.fns
property.description: Whether LLAP decider should allow permanent UDFs.

property.name: hive.llap.execution.mode
property.description: Expects one of [auto, none, all, map, only]. Chooses whether query fragments will run in container or in llap

property.name: hive.llap.object.cache.enabled
property.description: Cache objects (plans, hashtables, etc) in llap

property.name: hive.llap.io.decoding.metrics.percentiles.intervals
property.description: Comma-delimited set of integers denoting the desired rollover intervals (in seconds) for percentile latency metrics on the LLAP daemon IO decoding time. hive.llap.queue.metrics.percentiles.intervals

property.name: hive.llap.io.threadpool.size
property.description: Specify the number of threads to use for low-level IO thread pool.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.service.principal
property.description: The name of the LLAP daemon's service principal.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.keytab.file
property.description: The path to the Kerberos Keytab file containing the LLAP daemon's service principal.

property.name: hive.llap.webui.spnego.keytab
property.description: The path to the Kerberos Keytab file containing the LLAP WebUI SPNEGO principal. Typical value would look like /etc/security/keytabs/spnego.service.keytab.

property.name: hive.llap.webui.spnego.principal
property.description: The LLAP WebUI SPNEGO service principal. Configured similarly to hive.server2.webui.spnego.principal

property.name: hive.llap.task.principal
property.description: The name of the principal to use to run tasks. By default, the clients are required to provide tokens to access HDFS/etc.

property.name: hive.llap.task.keytab.file
property.description: The path to the Kerberos Keytab file containing the principal to use to run tasks. By default, the clients are required to provide tokens to access HDFS/etc.

property.name: hive.llap.zk.sm.connectionString
property.description: ZooKeeper connection string for ZooKeeper SecretManager.

property.name: hive.llap.zk.sm.session.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. ZooKeeper session timeout for ZK SecretManager.

property.name: hive.llap.zk.registry.user
property.description: In the LLAP ZooKeeper-based registry, specifies the username in the Zookeeper path. This should be the hive user or whichever user is running the LLAP daemon.

property.name: hive.llap.zk.registry.namespace
property.description: In the LLAP ZooKeeper-based registry, overrides the ZK path namespace. Note that using this makes the path management (e.g. setting correct ACLs) your responsibility.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.acl
property.description: The ACL for LLAP daemon.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.acl.blocked
property.description: The deny ACL for LLAP daemon.

property.name: hive.llap.management.acl
property.description: The ACL for LLAP daemon management.

property.name: hive.llap.management.acl.blocked
property.description: The deny ACL for LLAP daemon management.

property.name: hive.llap.plugin.acl
property.description: The ACL for LLAP plugin AM endpoint.

property.name: hive.llap.plugin.acl.blocked
property.description: The deny ACL for LLAP plugin AM endpoint.

property.name: hive.llap.remote.token.requires.signing
property.description: Expects one of [false, except_llap_owner, true]. Whether the token returned from LLAP management API should require fragment signing. True by default; can be disabled to allow CLI to get tokens from LLAP in a secure cluster by setting it to true or 'except_llap_owner' (the latter returns such tokens to everyone except the user LLAP cluster is authenticating under).

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.delegation.token.lifetime
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. LLAP delegation token lifetime, in seconds if specified without a unit.

property.name: hive.llap.management.rpc.port
property.description: RPC port for LLAP daemon management service.

property.name: hive.llap.auto.auth
property.description: Whether or not to set Hadoop configs to enable auth in LLAP web app.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.rpc.num.handlers
property.description: Number of RPC handlers for LLAP daemon.

property.name: hive.llap.plugin.rpc.num.handlers
property.description: Number of RPC handlers for AM LLAP plugin endpoint.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.work.dirs
property.description: Working directories for the daemon. This should not be set if running as a YARN Service. It must be set when not running on YARN. If the value is set when running as a YARN Service, the specified value will be used.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.yarn.shuffle.port
property.description: YARN shuffle port for LLAP-daemon-hosted shuffle.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.yarn.container.mb
property.description: llap server yarn container size in MB. Used in LlapServiceDriver and package.py

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.queue.name
property.description: Queue name within which the llap application will run. Used in LlapServiceDriver and package.py

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.container.id
property.description: ContainerId of a running LlapDaemon. Used to publish to the registry

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.nm.address
property.description: NM Address host:rpcPort for the NodeManager on which the instance of the daemon is running. Published to the llap registry. Should never be set by users

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.shuffle.dir.watcher.enabled
property.description: TODO doc

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.am.liveness.heartbeat.interval.ms
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Tez AM-LLAP heartbeat interval (milliseconds). This needs to be below the task timeout interval, but otherwise as high as possible to avoid unnecessary traffic.

property.name: hive.llap.am.liveness.connection.timeout.ms
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Amount of time to wait on connection failures to the AM from an LLAP daemon before considering the AM to be dead.

property.name: hive.llap.am.use.fqdn
property.description: Whether to use FQDN of the AM machine when submitting work to LLAP.

property.name: hive.llap.am.liveness.connection.sleep.between.retries.ms
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Sleep duration while waiting to retry connection failures to the AM from the daemon for the general keep-alive thread (milliseconds).

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.timeout.seconds
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Amount of time to wait before failing the query when there are no llap daemons running (alive) in the cluster.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.num.executors
property.description: Number of executors to use in LLAP daemon; essentially, the number of tasks that can be executed in parallel.

property.name: hive.llap.mapjoin.memory.oversubscribe.factor
property.description: Fraction of memory from hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask.size that can be over subscribed by queries running in LLAP mode. This factor has to be from 0.0 to 1.0. Default is 20% over subscription.

property.name: hive.llap.memory.oversubscription.max.executors.per.query
property.description: Used along with hive.llap.mapjoin.memory.oversubscribe.factor to limit the number of executors from which memory for mapjoin can be borrowed. Default 3 (from 3 other executors hive.llap.mapjoin.memory.oversubscribe.factor amount of memory can be borrowed based on which mapjoin conversion decision will be made). This is only an upper bound. Lower bound is determined by number of executors and configured max concurrency.

property.name: hive.llap.mapjoin.memory.monitor.check.interval
property.description: Check memory usage of mapjoin hash tables after every interval of this many rows. If map join hash table memory usage exceeds (hive.auto.convert.join.noconditionaltask.size * hive.hash.table.inflation.factor) when running in LLAP, tasks will get killed and not retried. Set the value to 0 to disable this feature.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.am-reporter.max.threads
property.description: Maximum number of threads to be used for AM reporter. If this is lower than number of executors in llap daemon, it would be set to number of executors at runtime.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.rpc.port
property.description: The LLAP daemon RPC port.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.memory.per.instance.mb
property.description: The total amount of memory to use for the executors inside LLAP (in megabytes).

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.xmx.headroom
property.description: The total amount of heap memory set aside by LLAP and not used by the executors. Can be specified as size (e.g. '512Mb'), or percentage (e.g. '5%'). Note that the latter is derived from the total daemon XMX, which can be different from the total executor memory if the cache is on-heap; although that's not the default configuration.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.vcpus.per.instance
property.description: The total number of vcpus to use for the executors inside LLAP.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.num.file.cleaner.threads
property.description: Number of file cleaner threads in LLAP.

property.name: hive.llap.file.cleanup.delay.seconds
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. How long to delay before cleaning up query files in LLAP (in seconds, for debugging).

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.service.hosts
property.description: Explicitly specified hosts to use for LLAP scheduling. Useful for testing. By default, YARN registry is used.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.service.refresh.interval.sec
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. LLAP YARN registry service list refresh delay, in seconds.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.communicator.num.threads
property.description: Number of threads to use in LLAP task communicator in Tez AM.

property.name: hive.llap.plugin.client.num.threads
property.description: Number of threads to use in LLAP task plugin client.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.download.permanent.fns
property.description: Whether LLAP daemon should localize the resources for permanent UDFs.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.am.registry
property.description: AM registry name for LLAP task scheduler plugin to register with.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.am.registry.principal
property.description: The name of the principal used to access ZK AM registry securely.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.am.registry.keytab.file
property.description: The path to the Kerberos keytab file used to access ZK AM registry securely.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.node.reenable.min.timeout.ms
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Minimum time after which a previously disabled node will be re-enabled for scheduling, in milliseconds. This may be modified by an exponential back-off if failures persist.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.node.reenable.max.timeout.ms
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Maximum time after which a previously disabled node will be re-enabled for scheduling, in milliseconds. This may be modified by an exponential back-off if failures persist.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.node.disable.backoff.factor
property.description: Backoff factor on successive blacklists of a node due to some failures. Blacklist times start at the min timeout and go up to the max timeout based on this backoff factor.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.preempt.independent
property.description: Whether the AM LLAP scheduler should preempt a lower priority task for a higher pri one even if the former doesn't depend on the latter (e.g. for two parallel sides of a union).

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.num.schedulable.tasks.per.node
property.description: The number of tasks the AM TaskScheduler will try allocating per node. 0 indicates that this should be picked up from the Registry. -1 indicates unlimited capacity; positive values indicate a specific bound.

property.name: hive.llap.task.scheduler.locality.delay
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. The time should be in between -1 msec (inclusive) and 9223372036854775807 msec (inclusive). Amount of time to wait before allocating a request which contains location information, to a location other than the ones requested. Set to -1 for an infinite delay, 0for no delay.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.task.preemption.metrics.intervals
property.description: Comma-delimited set of integers denoting the desired rollover intervals (in seconds) for percentile latency metrics. Used by LLAP daemon task scheduler metrics for time taken to kill task (due to pre-emption) and useful time wasted by the task that is about to be preempted.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.task.scheduler.wait.queue.size
property.description: LLAP scheduler maximum queue size.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.wait.queue.comparator.class.name
property.description: The priority comparator to use for LLAP scheduler priority queue. The built-in options are org.apache.hadoop.hive.llap.daemon.impl.comparator.ShortestJobFirstComparator and .....FirstInFirstOutComparator

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.task.scheduler.enable.preemption
property.description: Whether non-finishable running tasks (e.g. a reducer waiting for inputs) should be preempted by finishable tasks inside LLAP scheduler.

property.name: hive.llap.task.communicator.connection.timeout.ms
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Connection timeout (in milliseconds) before a failure to an LLAP daemon from Tez AM.

property.name: hive.llap.task.communicator.listener.thread-count
property.description: The number of task communicator listener threads.

property.name: hive.llap.task.communicator.connection.sleep.between.retries.ms
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Sleep duration (in milliseconds) to wait before retrying on error when obtaining a connection to LLAP daemon from Tez AM.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.web.port
property.description: LLAP daemon web UI port.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.web.ssl
property.description: Whether LLAP daemon web UI should use SSL.

property.name: hive.llap.client.consistent.splits
property.description: Whether to setup split locations to match nodes on which llap daemons are running, instead of using the locations provided by the split itself. If there is no llap daemon running, fall back to locations provided by the split. This is effective only if hive.execution.mode is llap

property.name: hive.llap.validate.acls
property.description: Whether LLAP should reject permissive ACLs in some cases (e.g. its own management protocol or ZK paths), similar to how ssh refuses a key with bad access permissions.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.output.service.port
property.description: LLAP daemon output service port

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.output.stream.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. The timeout for the client to connect to LLAP output service and start the fragment output after sending the fragment. The fragment will fail if its output is not claimed.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.output.service.send.buffer.size
property.description: Send buffer size to be used by LLAP daemon output service

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.output.service.max.pending.writes
property.description: Maximum number of queued writes allowed per connection when sending data via the LLAP output service to external clients.

property.name: hive.llap.external.splits.temp.table.storage.format
property.description: Expects one of [default, text, orc]. Storage format for temp tables created using LLAP external client

property.name: hive.llap.external.splits.order.by.force.single.split
property.description: If LLAP external clients submits ORDER BY queries, force return a single split to guarantee reading data out in ordered way. Setting this to false will let external clients read data out in parallel losing the ordering (external clients are responsible for guaranteeing the ordering)

property.name: hive.llap.enable.grace.join.in.llap
property.description: Override if grace join should be allowed to run in llap.

property.name: hive.llap.hs2.coordinator.enabled
property.description: Whether to create the LLAP coordinator; since execution engine and container vs llap settings are both coming from job configs, we don't know at start whether this should be created. Default true.

property.name: hive.llap.daemon.logger
property.description: Expects one of [query-routing, rfa, console]. logger used for llap-daemons.

property.name: hive.llap.output.format.arrow
property.description: Whether LLapOutputFormatService should output arrow batches

property.name: hive.trigger.validation.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Interval for validating triggers during execution of a query. Triggers defined in resource plan will get validated for all SQL operations after every defined interval (default: 500ms) and corresponding action defined in the trigger will be taken

property.name: hive.spark.use.op.stats
property.description: Whether to use operator stats to determine reducer parallelism for Hive on Spark. If this is false, Hive will use source table stats to determine reducer parallelism for all first level reduce tasks, and the maximum reducer parallelism from all parents for all the rest (second level and onward) reducer tasks.

property.name: hive.spark.use.ts.stats.for.mapjoin
property.description: If this is set to true, mapjoin optimization in Hive/Spark will use statistics from TableScan operators at the root of operator tree, instead of parent ReduceSink operators of the Join operator.

property.name: hive.spark.optimize.shuffle.serde
property.description: If this is set to true, Hive on Spark will register custom serializers for data types in shuffle. This should result in less shuffled data.

property.name: hive.spark.client.future.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Timeout for requests from Hive client to remote Spark driver.

property.name: hive.spark.job.monitor.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Timeout for job monitor to get Spark job state.

property.name: hive.spark.client.connect.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Timeout for remote Spark driver in connecting back to Hive client.

property.name: hive.spark.client.server.connect.timeout
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is msec if not specified. Timeout for handshake between Hive client and remote Spark driver. Checked by both processes.

property.name: hive.spark.client.secret.bits
property.description: Number of bits of randomness in the generated secret for communication between Hive client and remote Spark driver. Rounded down to the nearest multiple of 8.

property.name: hive.spark.client.rpc.threads
property.description: Maximum number of threads for remote Spark driver's RPC event loop.

property.name: hive.spark.client.rpc.max.size
property.description: Maximum message size in bytes for communication between Hive client and remote Spark driver. Default is 50MB.

property.name: hive.spark.client.channel.log.level
property.description: Channel logging level for remote Spark driver. One of {DEBUG, ERROR, INFO, TRACE, WARN}.

property.name: hive.spark.client.rpc.sasl.mechanisms
property.description: Name of the SASL mechanism to use for authentication.

property.name: hive.spark.client.rpc.server.address
property.description: The server address of HiverServer2 host to be used for communication between Hive client and remote Spark driver. Default is empty, which means the address will be determined in the same way as for hive.server2.thrift.bind.host.This is only necessary if the host has multiple network addresses and if a different network address other than hive.server2.thrift.bind.host is to be used.

property.name: hive.spark.client.rpc.server.port
property.description: A list of port ranges which can be used by RPC server with the format of 49152-49222,49228 and a random one is selected from the list. Default is empty, which randomly selects one port from all available ones.

property.name: hive.spark.dynamic.partition.pruning
property.description: When dynamic pruning is enabled, joins on partition keys will be processed by writing to a temporary HDFS file, and read later for removing unnecessary partitions.

property.name: hive.spark.dynamic.partition.pruning.max.data.size
property.description: Maximum total data size in dynamic pruning.

property.name: hive.spark.dynamic.partition.pruning.map.join.only
property.description: Turn on dynamic partition pruning only for map joins. If hive.spark.dynamic.partition.pruning is set to true, this parameter value is ignored.

property.name: hive.spark.use.groupby.shuffle
property.description: Spark groupByKey transformation has better performance but uses unbounded memory.Turn this off when there is a memory issue.

property.name: hive.spark.job.max.tasks
property.description: The maximum number of tasks a Spark job may have. If a Spark job contains more tasks than the maximum, it will be cancelled. A value of -1 means no limit.

property.name: hive.spark.stage.max.tasks
property.description: The maximum number of tasks a stage in a Spark job may have. If a Spark job stage contains more tasks than the maximum, the job will be cancelled. A value of -1 means no limit.

property.name: hive.reorder.nway.joins
property.description: Runs reordering of tables within single n-way join (i.e.: picks streamtable)

property.name: hive.merge.nway.joins
property.description: Merge adjacent joins into a single n-way join

property.name: hive.log.every.n.records
property.description: Expects value bigger than 0. If value is greater than 0 logs in fixed intervals of size n rather than exponentially.

property.name: hive.msck.path.validation
property.description: Expects one of [throw, skip, ignore]. The approach msck should take with HDFS directories that are partition-like but contain unsupported characters. 'throw' (an exception) is the default; 'skip' will skip the invalid directories and still repair the others; 'ignore' will skip the validation (legacy behavior, causes bugs in many cases)

property.name: hive.msck.repair.batch.size
property.description: Batch size for the msck repair command. If the value is greater than zero, it will execute batch wise with the configured batch size. In case of errors while adding unknown partitions the batch size is automatically reduced by half in the subsequent retry attempt. The default value is 3000 which means it will execute in the batches of 3000.

property.name: hive.msck.repair.batch.max.retries
property.description: Maximum number of retries for the msck repair command when adding unknown partitions. If the value is greater than zero it will retry adding unknown partitions until the maximum number of attempts is reached or batch size is reduced to 0, whichever is earlier. In each retry attempt it will reduce the batch size by a factor of 2 until it reaches zero. If the value is set to zero it will retry until the batch size becomes zero as described above.

property.name: hive.server2.llap.concurrent.queries
property.description: The number of queries allowed in parallel via llap. Negative number implies 'infinite'.

property.name: hive.tez.enable.memory.manager
property.description: Enable memory manager for tez

property.name: hive.hash.table.inflation.factor
property.description: Expected inflation factor between disk/in memory representation of hash tables

property.name: hive.log.trace.id
property.description: Log tracing id that can be used by upstream clients for tracking respective logs. Truncated to 64 characters. Defaults to use auto-generated session id.

property.name: hive.mm.avoid.s3.globstatus
property.description: Whether to use listFiles (optimized on S3) instead of globStatus when on S3.

property.name: hive.conf.restricted.list
property.description: Comma separated list of configuration options which are immutable at runtime

property.name: hive.conf.hidden.list
property.description: Comma separated list of configuration options which should not be read by normal user like passwords

property.name: hive.conf.internal.variable.list
property.description: Comma separated list of variables which are used internally and should not be configurable.

property.name: hive.spark.rsc.conf.list
property.description: Comma separated list of variables which are related to remote spark context. Changing these variables will result in re-creating the spark session.

property.name: hive.query.timeout.seconds
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Timeout for Running Query in seconds. A nonpositive value means infinite. If the query timeout is also set by thrift API call, the smaller one will be taken.

property.name: hive.exec.input.listing.max.threads
property.description: Expects a byte size value with unit (blank for bytes, kb, mb, gb, tb, pb). The size should be in between 0Pb (inclusive) and 1Kb (inclusive). Maximum number of threads that Hive uses to list file information from file systems (recommended > 1 for blobstore).

property.name: hive.query.reexecution.enabled
property.description: Enable query reexecutions

property.name: hive.query.reexecution.strategies
property.description: comma separated list of plugin can be used: overlay: hiveconf subtree 'reexec.overlay' is used as an overlay in case of an execution errors out reoptimize: collects operator statistics during execution and recompile the query after a failure

property.name: hive.query.reexecution.stats.persist.scope
property.description: Expects one of [query, hiveserver, metastore]. Sets the persistence scope of runtime statistics query: runtime statistics are only used during re-execution hiveserver: runtime statistics are persisted in the hiveserver - all sessions share it metastore: runtime statistics are persisted in the metastore as well

property.name: hive.query.reexecution.max.count
property.description: Maximum number of re-executions for a single query.

property.name: hive.query.reexecution.always.collect.operator.stats
property.description: If sessionstats are enabled; this option can be used to collect statistics all the time

property.name: hive.query.reexecution.stats.cache.batch.size
property.description: If runtime stats are stored in metastore; the maximal batch size per round during load.

property.name: hive.query.reexecution.stats.cache.size
property.description: Size of the runtime statistics cache. Unit is: OperatorStat entry; a query plan consist ~100.

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.enabled
property.description: If the query results cache is enabled. This will keep results of previously executed queries to be reused if the same query is executed again.

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.nontransactional.tables.enabled
property.description: If the query results cache is enabled for queries involving non-transactional tables.Users who enable this setting should be willing to tolerate some amount of stale results in the cache.

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.wait.for.pending.results
property.description: Should a query wait for the pending results of an already running query, in order to use the cached result when it becomes ready

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.directory
property.description: Location of the query results cache directory. Temporary results from queries will be moved to this location.

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.max.entry.lifetime
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. Maximum lifetime in seconds for an entry in the query results cache. A nonpositive value means infinite.

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.max.size
property.description: Maximum total size in bytes that the query results cache directory is allowed to use on the filesystem.

property.name: hive.query.results.cache.max.entry.size
property.description: Maximum size in bytes that a single query result is allowed to use in the results cache directory

property.name: hive.notification.event.poll.interval
property.description: Expects a time value with unit (d/day, h/hour, m/min, s/sec, ms/msec, us/usec, ns/nsec), which is sec if not specified. How often the notification log is polled for new NotificationEvents from the metastore.A nonpositive value means the notification log is never polled.

property.name: hive.notification.event.consumers
property.description: Comma-separated list of class names extending EventConsumer,to handle the NotificationEvents retreived by the notification event poll.

property.name: hive.blobstore.supported.schemes
property.description: Comma-separated list of supported blobstore schemes.

property.name: hive.blobstore.use.blobstore.as.scratchdir
property.description: Enable the use of scratch directories directly on blob storage systems (it may cause performance penalties).

property.name: hive.blobstore.optimizations.enabled
property.description: This parameter enables a number of optimizations when running on blobstores: (1) If hive.blobstore.use.blobstore.as.scratchdir is false, force the last Hive job to write to the blobstore. This is a performance optimization that forces the final FileSinkOperator to write to the blobstore. See HIVE-15121 for details.
